FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\base_agent\base_agent.py
   1: """
   2: BaseAgent - Classe de base pour tous les agents
   3: Version complÃ¨te et corrigÃ©e
   4: """
   5: import yaml
   6: import logging
   7: import os
   8: import asyncio
   9: from datetime import datetime
  10: from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Callable
  11: import hashlib
  12: import json
  13: 
  14: logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  15: 
  16: class BaseAgent:
  17:     """Classe de base pour tous les agents du pipeline"""
  18: 
  19:     def __init__(self, config_path: Optional[str] = None, agent_name: Optional[str] = None):
  20:         self.config = {}
  21:         self.name = agent_name or self.__class__.__name__
  22:         self.agent_type = self._get_agent_type()
  23:         self.logger = logging.getLogger(self.name)
  24:         self._initialized = False
  25:         self._capabilities = []
  26: 
  27:         if config_path:
  28:             self.load_config(config_path)
  29: 
  30:         self._initialized = True
  31:         self.logger.info(f"âœ… {self.name} initialisÃ© (type: {self.agent_type})")
  32: 
  33:     def _get_agent_type(self) -> str:
  34:         """DÃ©termine le type d'agent basÃ© sur le nom de classe"""
  35:         class_name = self.__class__.__name__
  36:         if 'SubAgent' in class_name:
  37:             return 'sous_agent'
  38:         elif 'Agent' in class_name:
  39:             return 'agent_principal'
  40:         return 'agent_generique'
  41: 
  42:     def load_config(self, config_path: str) -> bool:
  43:         """Charge la configuration depuis un fichier YAML"""
  44:         try:
  45:             if not config_path:
  46:                 self.logger.warning("Aucun chemin de configuration fourni")
  47:                 self.config = {"agent_name": self.name}
  48:                 return False
  49: 
  50:             if os.path.exists(config_path):
  51:                 with open(config_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
  52:                     loaded_config = yaml.safe_load(f) or {}
  53: 
  54:                 # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  55:                 default_config = {
  56:                     "agent_name": self.name,
  57:                     "agent_type": self.agent_type,
  58:                     "version": "1.0.0",
  59:                     "enabled": True,
  60:                     "capabilities": [],
  61:                     "created_at": datetime.now().isoformat()
  62:                 }
  63: 
  64:                 # Fusion avec la config chargÃ©e
  65:                 self.config = {**default_config, **loaded_config}
  66:                 self._capabilities = self.config.get("capabilities", [])
  67: 
  68:                 self.logger.info(f"âœ… Configuration chargÃ©e: {config_path}")
  69:                 return True
  70:             else:
  71:                 self.logger.warning(f"âš ï¸ Fichier config non trouvÃ©: {config_path}")
  72:                 self.config = {"agent_name": self.name, "config_missing": True}
  73:                 return False
  74: 
  75:         except yaml.YAMLError as e:
  76:             self.logger.error(f"âŒ Erreur YAML dans {config_path}: {e}")
  77:             self.config = {"agent_name": self.name, "yaml_error": str(e)}
  78:             return False
  79:         except Exception as e:
  80:             self.logger.error(f"âŒ Erreur chargement config {config_path}: {e}")
  81:             self.config = {"agent_name": self.name, "error": str(e)}
  82:             return False
  83: 
  84:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  85:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che - Ã€ surcharger par les agents enfants"""
  86:         try:
  87:             task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "unknown")
  88:             self.logger.info(f"ExÃ©cution tÃ¢che: {task_type}")
  89: 
  90:             # RÃ©ponse par dÃ©faut
  91:             return {
  92:                 "status": "success",
  93:                 "agent": self.name,
  94:                 "agent_type": self.agent_type,
  95:                 "task": task_type,
  96:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
  97:                 "config_loaded": bool(self.config) and not self.config.get("config_missing"),
  98:                 "message": f"TÃ¢che '{task_type}' exÃ©cutÃ©e par {self.name}"
  99:             }
 100: 
 101:         except Exception as e:
 102:             self.logger.error(f"Erreur lors de l'exÃ©cution: {e}")
 103:             return {
 104:                 "status": "error",
 105:                 "agent": self.name,
 106:                 "error": str(e),
 107:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
 108:             }
 109: 
 110:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 111:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© de l'agent"""
 112:         try:
 113:             health_status = {
 114:                 "status": "healthy",
 115:                 "agent": self.name,
 116:                 "type": self.agent_type,
 117:                 "initialized": self._initialized,
 118:                 "config_loaded": bool(self.config) and not self.config.get("config_missing"),
 119:                 "capabilities": self._capabilities,
 120:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
 121:                 "checks": {
 122:                     "config": bool(self.config),
 123:                     "initialized": self._initialized,
 124:                     "methods": {
 125:                         "execute": callable(self.execute),
 126:                         "health_check": callable(self.health_check)
 127:                     }
 128:                 }
 129:             }
 130: 
 131:             # VÃ©rifications supplÃ©mentaires
 132:             if self.config.get("config_missing"):
 133:                 health_status["status"] = "warning"
 134:                 health_status["warning"] = "Configuration manquante"
 135:             elif self.config.get("error"):
 136:                 health_status["status"] = "error"
 137:                 health_status["error"] = self.config.get("error")
 138: 
 139:             return health_status
 140: 
 141:         except Exception as e:
 142:             return {
 143:                 "status": "error",
 144:                 "agent": self.name,
 145:                 "error": str(e),
 146:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
 147:             }
 148: 
 149:     def get_capabilities(self) -> List[str]:
 150:         """Retourne les capacitÃ©s de l'agent"""
 151:         return self._capabilities
 152: 
 153:     def add_capability(self, capability: str) -> None:
 154:         """Ajoute une capacitÃ© Ã  l'agent"""
 155:         if capability not in self._capabilities:
 156:             self._capabilities.append(capability)
 157:             self.logger.info(f"CapacitÃ© ajoutÃ©e: {capability}")
 158: 
 159:     def generate_hash(self, data: Any) -> str:
 160:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re un hash MD5 pour les donnÃ©es"""
 161:         try:
 162:             data_str = json.dumps(data, sort_keys=True) if not isinstance(data, str) else data
 163:             return hashlib.md5(data_str.encode()).hexdigest()
 164:         except Exception as e:
 165:             self.logger.error(f"Erreur gÃ©nÃ©ration hash: {e}")
 166:             return "hash_error"
 167: 
 168:     def validate_task_data(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], required_fields: List[str]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 169:         """Valide les donnÃ©es de tÃ¢che"""
 170:         validation_result = {
 171:             "valid": True,
 172:             "missing_fields": [],
 173:             "errors": []
 174:         }
 175: 
 176:         for field in required_fields:
 177:             if field not in task_data:
 178:                 validation_result["valid"] = False
 179:                 validation_result["missing_fields"].append(field)
 180: 
 181:         return validation_result
 182: 
 183:     async def execute_with_timeout(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any],
 184:                                  timeout: int = 30) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 185:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che avec timeout"""
 186:         try:
 187:             return await asyncio.wait_for(self.execute(task_data, context), timeout=timeout)
 188:         except asyncio.TimeoutError:
 189:             self.logger.error(f"Timeout sur la tÃ¢che: {task_data.get('task_type', 'unknown')}")
 190:             return {
 191:                 "status": "timeout",
 192:                 "agent": self.name,
 193:                 "task": task_data.get("task_type", "unknown"),
 194:                 "message": f"Timeout aprÃ¨s {timeout} secondes"
 195:             }
 196:         except Exception as e:
 197:             self.logger.error(f"Erreur avec timeout: {e}")
 198:             return {
 199:                 "status": "error",
 200:                 "agent": self.name,
 201:                 "error": str(e)
 202:             }

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\base_agent\config.yaml
   1: # Configuration de base pour tous les agents
   2: # Emplacement: agents/base_agent/config.yaml
   3: 
   4: # ============================================================================
   5: # CONFIGURATION GÃ‰NÃ‰RALE DE L'AGENT
   6: # ============================================================================
   7: agent:
   8:   name: "BaseAgent"
   9:   version: "1.0.0"
  10:   description: "Classe de base pour tous les agents du pipeline"
  11:   type: "abstract_base"
  12: 
  13:   # Statut et disponibilitÃ©
  14:   enabled: true
  15:   initialized: false
  16:   health_check_interval: 60  # secondes
  17: 
  18:   # Journalisation
  19:   logging:
  20:     level: "INFO"
  21:     format: "%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s"
  22:     file_path: "logs/agents/base_agent.log"
  23:     max_file_size_mb: 10
  24:     backup_count: 5
  25: 
  26: # ============================================================================
  27: # CAPACITÃ‰S DE BASE
  28: # ============================================================================
  29: capabilities:
  30:   - "health_check"
  31:   - "execute_tasks"
  32:   - "load_configuration"
  33:   - "validate_input"
  34:   - "error_handling"
  35:   - "timeout_management"
  36: 
  37: # ============================================================================
  38: # PARAMÃˆTRES D'EXÃ‰CUTION
  39: # ============================================================================
  40: execution:
  41:   # Timeouts par dÃ©faut
  42:   default_task_timeout: 30  # secondes
  43:   max_task_timeout: 300     # secondes
  44:   health_check_timeout: 10  # secondes
  45: 
  46:   # Politique de retry
  47:   retry_policy:
  48:     enabled: true
  49:     max_retries: 3
  50:     initial_delay: 1  # seconde
  51:     max_delay: 10     # secondes
  52:     exponential_backoff: true
  53: 
  54:   # Validation des tÃ¢ches
  55:   validation:
  56:     required_task_fields: ["task_type"]
  57:     max_task_size_kb: 1024  # 1MB max
  58: 
  59: # ============================================================================
  60: # CONFIGURATION DE LA SÃ‰CURITÃ‰
  61: # ============================================================================
  62: security:
  63:   # Validation des entrÃ©es
  64:   input_validation: true
  65:   max_input_depth: 10

  19:

  22:     "name": "base_agent",
  23:     "version": __version__,
  24:     "description": "Classe de base pour tous les agents du pipeline SmartContractDevPipeline",
  25:     "author": __author__,
  26:     "license": __license__,
  27:     "dependencies": ["pyyaml>=6.0", "typing-extensions>=4.0"],
  28:     "python_version": ">=3.8"
  29: }
  30: 
  31: # VÃ©rification des dÃ©pendances au chargement
  32: def _check_dependencies():
  33:     """VÃ©rifie les dÃ©pendances requises"""
  34:     import sys
  35: 
  36:     # VÃ©rification version Python
  37:     if sys.version_info < (3, 8):
  38:         raise RuntimeError(f"Python 3.8 ou supÃ©rieur requis (version actuelle: {sys.version})")
  39: 
  40:     # VÃ©rification des packages
  41:     missing_packages = []
  42:     try:
  43:         import yaml
  44:     except ImportError:
  45:         missing_packages.append("pyyaml")
  46: 
  47:     try:
  48:         from typing import get_origin
  49:     except ImportError:
  50:         missing_packages.append("typing-extensions")
  51: 
  52:     if missing_packages:
  53:         raise ImportError(
  54:             f"Packages manquants: {', '.join(missing_packages)}. "
  55:             f"Installez-les avec: pip install {' '.join(missing_packages)}"
  56:         )
  57: 
  58:     return True
  59: 
  60: # ExÃ©cuter la vÃ©rification
  61: _dependencies_checked = False
  62: if not _dependencies_checked:
  63:     _check_dependencies()
  64:     _dependencies_checked = True
  65: 
  66: # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  67: DEFAULT_CONFIG = {
  68:     "agent": {
  69:         "name": "BaseAgent",
  70:         "version": "1.0.0",
  71:         "type": "abstract_base"
  72:     },
  73:     "capabilities": [
  74:         "health_check",
  75:         "execute_tasks",
  76:         "load_configuration"
  77:     ]
  78: }
  79: 
  80: # Utilitaires d'import
  81: def create_base_agent(config_path: str = None, **kwargs):
  82:     """
  83:     CrÃ©e une instance de BaseAgent avec la configuration fournie
  84: 
  85:     Args:
  86:         config_path: Chemin vers le fichier de configuration YAML
  87:         **kwargs: Arguments supplÃ©mentaires pour le constructeur
  88: 
  89:     Returns:
  90:         Instance de BaseAgent
  91:     """
  92:     return BaseAgent(config_path=config_path, **kwargs)
  93:

  97: 
  98:     Returns:
  99:         Dict avec les informations du package

 101:     return PACKAGE_INFO.copy()

   1: """
   2: Agent Coder - Responsable du dÃ©veloppement de code

   4: """
   5: from .base_agent import BaseAgent

   8: import random
   9: 
  10: class CoderAgent(BaseAgent):
  11:     """Agent principal pour le dÃ©veloppement de code"""
  12: 
  13:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = None):
  14:         super().__init__(config_path, "CoderAgent")
  15:         self.languages = self.config.get("languages", ["Python", "JavaScript", "TypeScript", "Java", "Go"])
  16:         self.frameworks = self.config.get("frameworks", ["React", "Node.js", "Spring", "Django", "FastAPI"])

  18:         self.code_style = self.config.get("code_style", "PEP8")
  19: 
  20:         # Ajout des capacitÃ©s
  21:         self.add_capability("code_generation")
  22:         self.add_capability("debugging")
  23:         self.add_capability("refactoring")
  24:         self.add_capability("code_review")
  25:         self.add_capability("testing")
  26: 
  27:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  28:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che de dÃ©veloppement"""
  29:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "code_generation")
  30:         self.logger.info(f"CoderAgent exÃ©cute: {task_type}")
  31: 
  32:         if task_type == "generate_code":
  33:             requirements = task_data.get("requirements", "Fonction de traitement basique")
  34:             language = task_data.get("language", "Python")
  35: 
  36:             result = {

  45:             }

  49:                 "issue": error_data.get("message", "Unknown error"),
  50:                 "root_cause": self._identify_root_cause(error_data),

  55:             }

  57:             result = {
  58:                 "improvements": [
  59:                     "RÃ©duction de la complexitÃ© cyclomatique",
  60:                     "Meilleur nommage des variables",
  61:                     "Ã‰limination de la duplication de code",
  62:                     "SÃ©paration des prÃ©occupations"
  63:                 ],

  66:                 "readability_score": random.randint(70, 95),
  67:                 "technical_debt_reduced": f"{random.randint(10, 50)} points"

  77:                         "Optimiser les boucles",
  78:                         "Utiliser des structures de donnÃ©es plus appropriÃ©es"
  79:                     ],

  92:                     "maintainability_index": random.randint(70, 95)

 111:     def _generate_sample_code(self, requirements: str, language: str = "Python") -> str:
 112:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re du code exemple basÃ© sur les exigences"""
 113: 
 114:         if language == "Python":
 115:             if "API" in requirements or "endpoint" in requirements:
 116:                 return '''from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException, Depends
 117: from pydantic import BaseModel
 118: from typing import Optional
 119: from datetime import datetime
 120: import logging
 121: 
 122: logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 123: 
 124: app = FastAPI(title="API Service")
 125: 
 126: class Item(BaseModel):
 127:     name: str
 128:     price: float
 129:     description: Optional[str] = None
 130: 
 131: class ItemResponse(BaseModel):
 132:     id: int
 133:     name: str
 134:     price: float
 135:     created_at: datetime
 136:     status: str
 137: 
 138: items_db = []
 139: current_id = 0
 140: 
 141: @app.post("/items/", response_model=ItemResponse)
 142: async def create_item(item: Item):
 143:     """Create a new item"""
 144:     global current_id
 145:     try:
 146:         current_id += 1
 147:         new_item = {
 148:             "id": current_id,
 149:             "name": item.name,
 150:             "price": item.price,
 151:             "description": item.description,
 152:             "created_at": datetime.now(),
 153:             "status": "active"
 154:         }
 155:         items_db.append(new_item)
 156: 
 157:         logger.info(f"Item created: {new_item['id']}")
 158:         return ItemResponse(**new_item)
 159: 
 160:     except Exception as e:
 161:         logger.error(f"Error creating item: {e}")
 162:         raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))
 163: 
 164: @app.get("/items/{item_id}", response_model=ItemResponse)
 165: async def read_item(item_id: int):
 166:     """Read an item by ID"""
 167:     for item in items_db:
 168:         if item["id"] == item_id:
 169:             return ItemResponse(**item)
 170:     raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Item not found")
 171: 
 172: @app.get("/items/")
 173: async def read_all_items(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100):
 174:     """Read all items with pagination"""
 175:     return items_db[skip:skip + limit]'''
 176: 
 177:             else:
 178:                 return '''def process_data(input_data: dict) -> dict:
 179:     """
 180:     Process input data with validation and transformation
 181: 
 182:     Args:
 183:         input_data: Dictionary containing data to process
 184: 
 185:     Returns:
 186:         Processed data dictionary
 187: 
 188:     Raises:
 189:         ValueError: If input data is invalid
 190:     """
 191:     import json
 192:     from datetime import datetime
 193: 
 194:     # Validate input
 195:     if not input_data:
 196:         raise ValueError("Input data cannot be empty")
 197: 
 198:     if not isinstance(input_data, dict):
 199:         raise TypeError("Input data must be a dictionary")
 200: 
 201:     # Process data
 202:     processed = {}
 203:     timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
 204: 
 205:     for key, value in input_data.items():
 206:         if isinstance(value, str):
 207:             processed[key] = value.upper()
 208:         elif isinstance(value, (int, float)):
 209:             processed[key] = value * 1.1  # Example transformation
 210:         elif isinstance(value, list):
 211:             processed[key] = [str(item) for item in value]
 212:         else:
 213:             processed[key] = value
 214: 
 215:     # Add metadata
 216:     processed["_metadata"] = {
 217:         "processed_at": timestamp,
 218:         "source": "data_processor",
 219:         "version": "1.0.0",
 220:         "items_processed": len(input_data)
 221:     }
 222: 
 223:     return processed
 224: 
 225: # Example usage
 226: if __name__ == "__main__":
 227:     sample_data = {"name": "test", "value": 100, "tags": ["a", "b", "c"]}
 228:     result = process_data(sample_data)
 229:     print(f"Processed: {result}")'''
 230: 
 231:         elif language == "JavaScript":
 232:             return '''/**
 233:  * Fetch user data from API with error handling
 234:  * @param {string} userId - User identifier
 235:  * @returns {Promise<Object>} User data or error
 236:  */
 237: async function fetchUserData(userId) {
 238:     const baseUrl = process.env.API_BASE_URL || 'https://api.example.com';
 239:     const timeoutMs = 5000;
 240: 
 241:     try {
 242:         // Create abort controller for timeout
 243:         const controller = new AbortController();
 244:         const timeoutId = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeoutMs);
 245: 
 246:         const response = await fetch(`${baseUrl}/users/${userId}`, {
 247:             method: 'GET',
 248:             headers: {
 249:                 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 250:                 'Authorization': `Bearer ${localStorage.getItem('token')}`
 251:             },
 252:             signal: controller.signal
 253:         });
 254: 
 255:         clearTimeout(timeoutId);
 256: 
 257:         if (!response.ok) {
 258:             throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);
 259:         }
 260: 
 261:         const data = await response.json();
 262: 
 263:         return {
 264:             success: true,
 265:             data: {
 266:                 ...data,
 267:                 fetchedAt: new Date().toISOString()
 268:             },
 269:             status: response.status,
 270:             metadata: {
 271:                 requestId: response.headers.get('x-request-id'),
 272:                 cache: response.headers.get('cache-control')
 273:             }
 274:         };
 275: 
 276:     } catch (error) {
 277:         console.error('Error fetching user data:', error);
 278: 
 279:         return {
 280:             success: false,
 281:             error: error.message,
 282:             errorType: error.name,
 283:             timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
 284:             retryable: !error.message.includes('abort')
 285:         };
 286:     }
 287: }
 288: 
 289: // Export for module usage
 290: if (typeof module !== 'undefined' && module.exports) {
 291:     module.exports = { fetchUserData };
 292: }'''
 293: 
 294:         elif language == "Java":
 295:             return '''import java.time.LocalDateTime;
 296: import java.util.HashMap;
 297: import java.util.Map;
 298: import java.util.logging.Logger;
 299: 
 300: /**
 301:  * Service for processing user transactions
 302:  */
 303: public class TransactionService {
 304: 
 305:     private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(TransactionService.class.getName());
 306: 
 307:     private final Map<String, Double> accountBalances;
 308: 
 309:     public TransactionService() {
 310:         this.accountBalances = new HashMap<>();
 311:         initializeSampleData();
 312:     }
 313: 
 314:     private void initializeSampleData() {
 315:         accountBalances.put("account1", 1000.0);
 316:         accountBalances.put("account2", 500.0);
 317:         accountBalances.put("account3", 750.0);
 318:     }
 319: 
 320:     /**
 321:      * Process a transaction between accounts
 322:      * @param fromAccount Source account ID
 323:      * @param toAccount Destination account ID
 324:      * @param amount Amount to transfer
 325:      * @return Transaction result
 326:      * @throws IllegalArgumentException if accounts or amount invalid
 327:      */
 328:     public Map<String, Object> processTransaction(String fromAccount, String toAccount, double amount) {
 329:         // Validate input
 330:         if (amount <= 0) {
 331:             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Amount must be positive");
 332:         }
 333: 
 334:         if (!accountBalances.containsKey(fromAccount)) {
 335:             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source account not found: " + fromAccount);
 336:         }
 337: 
 338:         if (!accountBalances.containsKey(toAccount)) {
 339:             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Destination account not found: " + toAccount);
 340:         }
 341: 
 342:         // Check sufficient funds
 343:         double fromBalance = accountBalances.get(fromAccount);
 344:         if (fromBalance < amount) {
 345:             throw new IllegalStateException("Insufficient funds in account: " + fromAccount);
 346:         }
 347: 
 348:         // Process transaction
 349:         accountBalances.put(fromAccount, fromBalance - amount);
 350:         accountBalances.put(toAccount, accountBalances.get(toAccount) + amount);
 351: 
 352:         // Log transaction
 353:         LOGGER.info(String.format(
 354:             "Transaction processed: %s -> %s, Amount: %.2f",
 355:             fromAccount, toAccount, amount
 356:         ));
 357: 
 358:         // Return result
 359:         Map<String, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
 360:         result.put("success", true);
 361:         result.put("transactionId", "txn_" + System.currentTimeMillis());
 362:         result.put("timestamp", LocalDateTime.now().toString());
 363:         result.put("fromAccount", fromAccount);
 364:         result.put("toAccount", toAccount);
 365:         result.put("amount", amount);
 366:         result.put("newFromBalance", accountBalances.get(fromAccount));
 367:         result.put("newToBalance", accountBalances.get(toAccount));
 368: 
 369:         return result;
 370:     }
 371: 
 372:     public double getAccountBalance(String accountId) {
 373:         return accountBalances.getOrDefault(accountId, 0.0);
 374:     }
 375: }'''
 376: 
 377:         else:
 378:             return f"# Code {language} gÃ©nÃ©rÃ© automatiquement\n# Requirements: {requirements}\n# Generated by CoderAgent"
 379: 
 380:     def _identify_root_cause(self, error_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
 381:         """Identifie la cause racine d'une erreur"""
 382:         error_message = error_data.get("message", "").lower()
 383: 
 384:         if "null" in error_message or "undefined" in error_message:
 385:             return "Variable non initialisÃ©e ou rÃ©fÃ©rence nulle"
 386:         elif "timeout" in error_message:
 387:             return "DÃ©lai d'attente dÃ©passÃ© - ressource non disponible ou trop lente"
 388:         elif "memory" in error_message:
 389:             return "Fuite mÃ©moire ou allocation excessive"
 390:         elif "permission" in error_message or "access" in error_message:
 391:             return "ProblÃ¨me de permissions ou d'accÃ¨s"
 392:         elif "syntax" in error_message:
 393:             return "Erreur de syntaxe dans le code"
 394:         elif "network" in error_message or "connection" in error_message:
 395:             return "ProblÃ¨me de rÃ©seau ou de connexion"
 396:         else:
 397:             return "Erreur non spÃ©cifique - besoin d'investigation approfondie"
 398: 
 399:     def _suggest_fix(self, error_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
 400:         """SuggÃ¨re une correction pour une erreur"""
 401:         root_cause = self._identify_root_cause(error_data)
 402: 
 403:         fixes = {
 404:             "Variable non initialisÃ©e ou rÃ©fÃ©rence nulle": "Ajouter une vÃ©rification null/undefined avant utilisation et initialiser toutes les variables",
 405:             "DÃ©lai d'attente dÃ©passÃ©": "Augmenter les timeouts, optimiser les requÃªtes, implÃ©menter des retries avec backoff",
 406:             "Fuite mÃ©moire": "Identifier et libÃ©rer les ressources non utilisÃ©es, utiliser des profilers mÃ©moire",
 407:             "ProblÃ¨me de permissions": "VÃ©rifier et corriger les permissions, utiliser le principe du moindre privilÃ¨ge",
 408:             "Erreur de syntaxe": "VÃ©rifier la syntaxe du code, utiliser un linter, corriger les fautes de frappe",
 409:             "ProblÃ¨me de rÃ©seau": "VÃ©rifier la connectivitÃ©, implÃ©menter une logique de retry, ajouter des fallbacks"
 410:         }
 411: 
 412:         return fixes.get(root_cause, "Examiner les logs dÃ©taillÃ©s et dÃ©boguer Ã©tape par Ã©tape")
 413: 
 414:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 415:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© de l'agent codeur"""
 416:         base_health = await super().health_check()
 417:         return {
 418:             **base_health,
 419:             "languages": self.languages,
 420:             "frameworks": self.frameworks,
 421:             "quality_target": f"{self.code_quality_target}%",
 422:             "code_style": self.code_style,
 423:             "lines_of_code_written": self.config.get("lines_of_code", 15420),
 424:             "bugs_fixed": self.config.get("bugs_fixed", 127),
 425:             "productivity": "Ã‰levÃ©e"
 426:         }

  74: 
  75: # Code du sous-agent Backend
  76: $backendAgentCode = @'
  77: # agents/coder/sous_agents/backend_coder.py
  78: import asyncio
  79: from typing import Dict, Any, List
  80: from pathlib import Path
  81: import yaml
  82: import json
  83: from ...shared.base_agent import BaseAgent
  84: 
  85: class BackendCoderSubAgent(BaseAgent):
  86:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en dÃ©veloppement backend"""
  87: 
  88:     def __init__(self, config_path: str):
  89:         super().__init__(config_path)
  90:         self.languages = self.config.get("capabilities", {}).get("languages", [])
  91:         self.frameworks = self._extract_frameworks()
  92: 
  93:     def _extract_frameworks(self) -> Dict[str, List[str]]:
  94:         """Extrait les frameworks par langage"""
  95:         frameworks = {}
  96:         for lang_cap in self.languages:
  97:             if '(' in lang_cap:
  98:                 lang = lang_cap.split('(')[0].strip()
  99:                 framework_str = lang_cap.split('(')[1].rstrip(')')
 100:                 frameworks[lang] = [f.strip() for f in framework_str.split(',')]
 101:         return frameworks
 102: 
 103:     async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 104:         """Initialise le sous-agent"""
 105:         self.logger.info(f"Initialisation du Backend Coder")
 106:         self.logger.info(f"Langages supportÃ©s: {list(self.frameworks.keys())}")
 107:         return True
 108: 
 109:     async def develop_api(self, api_spec: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 110:         """DÃ©veloppe une API complÃ¨te"""
 111:         self.logger.info(f"DÃ©veloppement de l'API: {api_spec.get('name', 'Unnamed API')}")
 112: 
 113:         # SÃ©lection du stack technologique
 114:         stack = await self._select_technology_stack(api_spec)
 115: 
 116:         # GÃ©nÃ©ration du code
 117:         generated_code = await self._generate_backend_code(api_spec, stack)
 118: 
 119:         # CrÃ©ation des tests
 120:         tests = await self._generate_tests(api_spec, stack)
 121: 
 122:         # Documentation
 123:         documentation = await self._generate_documentation(api_spec, stack)
 124: 
 125:         return {
 126:             "technology_stack": stack,
 127:             "generated_code": generated_code,
 128:             "tests": tests,
 129:             "documentation": documentation,
 130:             "deployment_config": await self._generate_deployment_config(stack)
 131:         }
 132: 
 133:     async def _select_technology_stack(self, api_spec: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 134:         """SÃ©lectionne le stack technologique optimal"""
 135:         requirements = api_spec.get("requirements", {})
 136: 
 137:         # CritÃ¨res de sÃ©lection
 138:         if requirements.get("high_performance"):
 139:             # Go ou Rust pour haute performance
 140:             if "Go" in self.frameworks:
 141:                 return {
 142:                     "language": "Go",
 143:                     "framework": self.frameworks["Go"][0] if self.frameworks["Go"] else "Gin",
 144:                     "database": "PostgreSQL",
 145:                     "cache": "Redis"
 146:                 }
 147: 
 148:         if requirements.get("rapid_development"):
 149:             # Python ou Node.js pour dÃ©veloppement rapide
 150:             if "Python" in self.frameworks:
 151:                 return {
 152:                     "language": "Python",
 153:                     "framework": self.frameworks["Python"][0] if self.frameworks["Python"] else "FastAPI",
 154:                     "database": "PostgreSQL",
 155:                     "cache": "Redis"
 156:                 }
 157: 
 158:         # Par dÃ©faut, utiliser Python
 159:         return {
 160:             "language": "Python",
 161:             "framework": "FastAPI",
 162:             "database": "PostgreSQL",
 163:             "cache": "Redis"
 164:         }
 165: 
 166:     async def _generate_backend_code(self, api_spec: Dict[str, Any], stack: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 167:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re le code backend"""
 168:         language = stack["language"]
 169:         framework = stack["framework"]
 170: 
 171:         code_structure = {
 172:             "main_file": await self._generate_main_file(api_spec, language, framework),
 173:             "models": await self._generate_models(api_spec, language),
 174:             "routes": await self._generate_routes(api_spec, language, framework),
 175:             "services": await self._generate_services(api_spec, language),
 176:             "database": await self._generate_database_code(api_spec, stack["database"], language),
 177:             "middleware": await self._generate_middleware(api_spec, language, framework),
 178:             "config": await self._generate_config_files(language, framework)
 179:         }
 180: 
 181:         return code_structure
 182: 
 183:     async def _generate_tests(self, api_spec: Dict[str, Any], stack: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 184:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re les tests"""
 185:         language = stack["language"]
 186: 
 187:         tests = {
 188:             "unit_tests": await self._generate_unit_tests(api_spec, language),
 189:             "integration_tests": await self._generate_integration_tests(api_spec, language),
 190:             "api_tests": await self._generate_api_tests(api_spec),
 191:             "performance_tests": await self._generate_performance_tests(api_spec)
 192:         }
 193: 
 194:         return tests
 195: 
 196:     async def execute(self, task: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 197:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che de dÃ©veloppement backend"""
 198:         task_type = task.get("type", "develop_api")
 199: 
 200:         if task_type == "develop_api":
 201:             return await self.develop_api(task.get("specification", {}))
 202:         elif task_type == "optimize_performance":
 203:             return await self.optimize_performance(task.get("codebase", {}))
 204:         elif task_type == "refactor_code":
 205:             return await self.refactor_code(task.get("codebase", {}))
 206:         elif task_type == "add_feature":
 207:             return await self.add_feature(task.get("feature", {}), task.get("codebase", {}))
 208:         else:
 209:             return {"error": f"Type de tÃ¢che non supportÃ©: {task_type}"}
 210: 
 211:     async def optimize_performance(self, codebase: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 212:         """Optimise les performances du code backend"""
 213:         optimizations = []
 214: 
 215:         # Analyse des bottlenecks
 216:         bottlenecks = await self._analyze_bottlenecks(codebase)
 217: 
 218:         for bottleneck in bottlenecks:
 219:             optimization = await self._generate_optimization(bottleneck)
 220:             optimizations.append(optimization)
 221: 
 222:         # GÃ©nÃ©ration du code optimisÃ©
 223:         optimized_code = await self._apply_optimizations(codebase, optimizations)
 224: 
 225:         return {
 226:             "bottlenecks_found": bottlenecks,
 227:             "optimizations_applied": optimizations,
 228:             "optimized_code": optimized_code,
 229:             "performance_gain_estimate": await self._estimate_performance_gain(optimizations)
 230:         }
 231: 
 232:     async def refactor_code(self, codebase: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 233:         """Refactorise le code pour amÃ©liorer la qualitÃ©"""
 234:         refactoring_actions = []
 235: 
 236:         # DÃ©tection des code smells
 237:         code_smells = await self._detect_code_smells(codebase)
 238: 
 239:         for smell in code_smells:
 240:             refactoring = await self._generate_refactoring(smell)
 241:             refactoring_actions.append(refactoring)
 242: 
 243:         # Application des refactorings
 244:         refactored_code = await self._apply_refactorings(codebase, refactoring_actions)
 245: 
 246:         return {
 247:             "code_smells_found": code_smells,
 248:             "refactoring_actions": refactoring_actions,
 249:             "refactored_code": refactored_code,
 250:             "quality_metrics": await self._calculate_quality_metrics(refactored_code)
 251:         }
 252: '@
 253: 
 254: $backendAgentCode | Out-File -FilePath "$projectPath\agents\coder\sous_agents\backend_coder.py" -Force -Encoding UTF8

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\coder\sous_agents\backend_coder\agent.py
   1: """
   2: Sous-agent Backend Development
   3: SpÃ©cialisation: Backend Development
   4: """
   5: from typing import Dict, Any
   6: import yaml
   7: import logging
   8: 
   9: class BackendCoderSubAgent:
  10:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en Backend Development"""
  11: 
  12:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = ""):
  13:         self.config_path = config_path
  14:         self.config = self._load_config()
  15:         self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  16:         self.agent_id = f"backend_coder_sub_01"
  17: 
  18:         self.logger.info(f"Sous-agent {self.agent_id} initialisÃ©")
  19: 
  20:     def _load_config(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  21:         """Charge la configuration"""
  22:         if self.config_path and os.path.exists(self.config_path):
  23:             try:
  24:                 with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
  25:                     return yaml.safe_load(f)
  26:             except Exception as e:
  27:                 self.logger.error(f"Erreur de chargement config: {e}")
  28: 
  29:         # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  30:         return {
  31:             "agent": {
  32:                 "name": "Backend Development",
  33:                 "specialization": "Backend Development",
  34:                 "version": "1.0.0"
  35:             },
  36:             "capabilities": ["task_execution", "specialized_operation"]
  37:         }
  38: 
  39:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  40:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che spÃ©cialisÃ©e"""
  41:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "unknown")
  42: 
  43:         self.logger.info(f"ExÃ©cution de la tÃ¢che {task_type}")
  44: 
  45:         # ImplÃ©mentation spÃ©cifique au sous-agent
  46:         result = await self._execute_specialized(task_data, context)
  47: 
  48:         return {
  49:             "success": True,
  50:             "sub_agent": "backend_coder",
  51:             "task": task_type,
  52:             "result": result,
  53:             "specialization": "Backend Development"
  54:         }
  55: 
  56:     async def _execute_specialized(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  57:         """MÃ©thode spÃ©cialisÃ©e Ã  implÃ©menter"""
  58:         # Ã€ implÃ©menter selon la spÃ©cialisation
  59:         return {
  60:             "message": "TÃ¢che exÃ©cutÃ©e par le sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ©",
  61:             "specialization": "Backend Development",
  62:             "input": task_data
  63:         }
  64: 
  65:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  66:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© du sous-agent"""
  67:         return {
  68:             "agent": "backend_coder",
  69:             "status": "healthy",
  70:             "type": "sub_agent",
  71:             "specialization": "Backend Development",
  72:             "config_loaded": bool(self.config)
  73:         }
  74: 
  75:     def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  76:         """Retourne les informations du sous-agent"""
  77:         return {
  78:             "id": self.agent_id,
  79:             "name": "Backend Development",
  80:             "type": "sub_agent",
  81:             "parent": "coder",
  82:             "specialization": "Backend Development",
  83:             "version": "1.0.0"
  84:         }

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\communication\agent_messaging.py
   1: # agents/communication/agent_messaging.py
   2: class AgentMessage:
   3:     """Format standardisÃ© des messages entre agents"""
   4: 
   5:     def __init__(self, sender: str, receiver: str, message_type: str):
   6:         self.sender = sender
   7:         self.receiver = receiver
   8:         self.message_type = message_type
   9:         self.timestamp = datetime.now()
  10:         self.message_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
  11: 
  12:     @dataclass
  13:     class Content:
  14:         task_id: str
  15:         context: dict
  16:         payload: Any  # Code, test results, docs, etc.
  17:         dependencies: List[str]
  18:         priority: int = 1
  19:         requires_response: bool = True
  20:         timeout_seconds: int = 300
  21: 
  22: # Types de messages supportÃ©s
  23: MESSAGE_TYPES = {
  24:     # Code-related
  25:     "code_review_request": {"from": "coder", "to": "reviewer"},
  26:     "code_review_completed": {"from": "reviewer", "to": "coder"},
  27:     "test_execution_request": {"from": "coder", "to": "tester"},
  28:     "test_results_ready": {"from": "tester", "to": "coder"},
  29: 
  30:     # Documentation
  31:     "doc_generation_request": {"from": "coder", "to": "documenter"},
  32:     "doc_review_needed": {"from": "documenter", "to": "reviewer"},
  33: 
  34:     # Architecture & Planning
  35:     "architecture_approval_needed": {"from": "architect", "to": "orchestrator"},
  36:     "task_completion_notification": {"from": "any", "to": "orchestrator"},
  37: 
  38:     # Quality & Security
  39:     "security_scan_request": {"from": "orchestrator", "to": "security"},
  40:     "quality_gate_failed": {"from": "tester", "to": "orchestrator"},
  41: 
  42:     # Human intervention
  43:     "human_approval_needed": {"from": "any", "to": "human"},
  44:     "blocker_identified": {"from": "any", "to": "orchestrator"},
  45: }
  46: 
  47: # SystÃ¨me de prioritÃ©
  48: PRIORITY_LEVELS = {
  49:     "CRITICAL": 1,    # Bloque le pipeline
  50:     "HIGH": 2,        # NÃ©cessite attention immÃ©diate
  51:     "MEDIUM": 3,      # Doit Ãªtre traitÃ© aujourd'hui
  52:     "LOW": 4,         # Peut attendre
  53:     "INFO": 5,        # Notification seulement
  54: }

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\communication\zeromq\message_bus.py
   1: # agents/communication/zeromq/message_bus.py (corrigÃ©)
   2: import zmq
   3: import json
   4: import asyncio
   5: import threading
   6: import logging
   7: from typing import Dict, Any, List, Callable, Optional
   8: from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
   9: from datetime import datetime
  10: from enum import Enum
  11: import uuid
  12: 
  13: logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
  14: logger = logging.getLogger("ZeroMQMessageBus")
  15: 
  16: class MessagePriority(Enum):
  17:     LOW = 1
  18:     NORMAL = 2
  19:     HIGH = 3
  20:     CRITICAL = 4
  21: 
  22: @dataclass
  23: class Message:
  24:     """Message format standardisÃ©"""
  25:     id: str
  26:     sender: str
  27:     receivers: List[str]
  28:     message_type: str
  29:     content: Dict[str, Any]
  30:     timestamp: str
  31:     priority: int = MessagePriority.NORMAL.value
  32:     requires_ack: bool = True
  33:     ttl: int = 300  # 5 minutes
  34: 
  35:     def __post_init__(self):
  36:         if not self.id:
  37:             self.id = str(uuid.uuid4())
  38:         if not self.timestamp:
  39:             self.timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
  40: 
  41:     def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  42:         return {
  43:             "id": self.id,
  44:             "sender": self.sender,
  45:             "receivers": self.receivers,
  46:             "message_type": self.message_type,
  47:             "content": self.content,
  48:             "timestamp": self.timestamp,
  49:             "priority": self.priority,
  50:             "requires_ack": self.requires_ack,
  51:             "ttl": self.ttl
  52:         }
  53: 
  54:     @classmethod
  55:     def from_dict(cls, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> 'Message':
  56:         return cls(
  57:             id=data.get("id", str(uuid.uuid4())),
  58:             sender=data.get("sender", "unknown"),
  59:             receivers=data.get("receivers", []),
  60:             message_type=data.get("message_type", data.get("type", "unknown")),
  61:             content=data.get("content", {}),
  62:             timestamp=data.get("timestamp", datetime.now().isoformat()),
  63:             priority=data.get("priority", MessagePriority.NORMAL.value),
  64:             requires_ack=data.get("requires_ack", True),
  65:             ttl=data.get("ttl", 300)
  66:         )
  67: 
  68: class ZeroMQMessageBus:
  69:     """Bus de messages basÃ© sur ZeroMQ - Version corrigÃ©e"""
  70: 
  71:     def __init__(self, host: str = "127.0.0.1", pub_port: int = 5555):
  72:         self.host = host
  73:         self.pub_port = pub_port
  74:         self.context = zmq.Context()
  75: 
  76:         # Configuration des sockets
  77:         self.publisher = None
  78:         self.subscribers_socket = None
  79:         self.router_socket = None
  80: 
  81:         # Structures de donnÃ©es
  82:         self.subscribers: Dict[str, List[str]] = {}
  83:         self.message_handlers: Dict[str, List[Callable]] = {}
  84:         self.message_cache: Dict[str, Message] = {}
  85: 
  86:         # Ã‰tat
  87:         self.running = False
  88:         self.receive_thread = None
  89:         self.router_thread = None
  90: 
  91:         # Initialisation
  92:         self._setup_sockets()
  93: 
  94:     def _setup_sockets(self):
  95:         """Configure les sockets ZeroMQ"""
  96:         try:
  97:             # Socket PUB pour la publication
  98:             self.publisher = self.context.socket(zmq.PUB)
  99:             self.publisher.setsockopt(zmq.LINGER, 0)
 100:             self.publisher.bind(f"tcp://{self.host}:{self.pub_port}")
 101: 
 102:             # Socket SUB pour les abonnements (exemple)
 103:             self.subscribers_socket = self.context.socket(zmq.SUB)
 104:             self.subscribers_socket.setsockopt_string(zmq.SUBSCRIBE, "")
 105: 
 106:             # Socket ROUTER pour requÃªtes/rÃ©ponses
 107:             self.router_socket = self.context.socket(zmq.ROUTER)
 108:             self.router_socket.bind(f"tcp://{self.host}:{self.pub_port + 2}")
 109: 
 110:             logger.info(f"Sockets ZeroMQ configurÃ©es sur {self.host}:{self.pub_port}")
 111: 
 112:         except zmq.ZMQError as e:
 113:             logger.error(f"Erreur configuration ZeroMQ: {e}")
 114:             raise
 115: 
 116:     def start(self):
 117:         """DÃ©marre le bus de messages"""
 118:         if self.running:
 119:             logger.warning("Bus dÃ©jÃ  en cours d'exÃ©cution")
 120:             return
 121: 
 122:         self.running = True
 123: 
 124:         # DÃ©marrer les threads
 125:         self.receive_thread = threading.Thread(
 126:             target=self._receive_loop,
 127:             daemon=True,
 128:             name="ZeroMQ-Receiver"
 129:         )
 130: 
 131:         self.router_thread = threading.Thread(
 132:             target=self._router_loop,
 133:             daemon=True,
 134:             name="ZeroMQ-Router"
 135:         )
 136: 
 137:         self.receive_thread.start()
 138:         self.router_thread.start()
 139: 
 140:         logger.info("ZeroMQ Message Bus dÃ©marrÃ©")
 141: 
 142:     def stop(self):
 143:         """ArrÃªte le bus de messages"""
 144:         self.running = False
 145: 
 146:         if self.receive_thread:
 147:             self.receive_thread.join(timeout=2.0)
 148: 
 149:         if self.router_thread:
 150:             self.router_thread.join(timeout=2.0)
 151: 
 152:         # Fermer les sockets
 153:         if self.publisher:
 154:             self.publisher.close()
 155: 
 156:         if self.subscribers_socket:
 157:             self.subscribers_socket.close()
 158: 
 159:         if self.router_socket:
 160:             self.router_socket.close()
 161: 
 162:         self.context.term()
 163:         logger.info("ZeroMQ Message Bus arrÃªtÃ©")
 164: 
 165:     def _receive_loop(self):
 166:         """Boucle de rÃ©ception des messages - CORRIGÃ‰E"""
 167:         poller = zmq.Poller()
 168:         poller.register(self.subscribers_socket, zmq.POLLIN)
 169: 
 170:         while self.running:
 171:             try:
 172:                 socks = dict(poller.poll(timeout=1000))  # Timeout 1s
 173: 
 174:                 if self.subscribers_socket in socks:
 175:                     # Recevoir le message
 176:                     topic = self.subscribers_socket.recv_string()
 177:                     message_data = self.subscribers_socket.recv_json()
 178: 
 179:                     # Traiter le message
 180:                     message = Message.from_dict(message_data)
 181:                     self._process_message(message)
 182: 
 183:             except zmq.ZMQError as e:
 184:                 if self.running:  # Seulement loguer si on est censÃ© tourner
 185:                     logger.error(f"Erreur ZeroMQ dans receive_loop: {e}")
 186:                 break
 187:             except Exception as e:
 188:                 logger.error(f"Erreur inattendue dans receive_loop: {e}")
 189: 
 190:     def _router_loop(self):
 191:         """Boucle de gestion des requÃªtes/rÃ©ponses - CORRIGÃ‰E"""
 192:         poller = zmq.Poller()
 193:         poller.register(self.router_socket, zmq.POLLIN)
 194: 
 195:         while self.running:
 196:             try:
 197:                 socks = dict(poller.poll(timeout=1000))
 198: 
 199:                 if self.router_socket in socks:
 200:                     # Recevoir la requÃªte multipart
 201:                     try:
 202:                         identity = self.router_socket.recv()
 203:                         empty = self.router_socket.recv()  # Frame vide
 204:                         request_data = self.router_socket.recv()
 205: 
 206:                         request = json.loads(request_data.decode('utf-8'))
 207:                         response = self._handle_request(request)
 208: 
 209:                         # Envoyer la rÃ©ponse
 210:                         response_data = json.dumps(response).encode('utf-8')
 211:                         self.router_socket.send_multipart([
 212:                             identity,
 213:                             b"",
 214:                             response_data
 215:                         ])
 216: 
 217:                     except (json.JSONDecodeError, UnicodeDecodeError) as e:
 218:                         logger.error(f"Erreur dÃ©codage requÃªte: {e}")
 219:                         error_response = {"status": "error", "message": "Invalid request format"}
 220:                         self.router_socket.send_multipart([
 221:                             identity,
 222:                             b"",
 223:                             json.dumps(error_response).encode('utf-8')
 224:                         ])
 225: 
 226:             except zmq.ZMQError as e:
 227:                 if self.running:
 228:                     logger.error(f"Erreur ZeroMQ dans router_loop: {e}")
 229:                 break
 230:             except Exception as e:
 231:                 logger.error(f"Erreur inattendue dans router_loop: {e}")
 232: 
 233:     def _process_message(self, message: Message):
 234:         """Traite un message reÃ§u"""
 235:         try:
 236:             # VÃ©rifier TTL
 237:             message_time = datetime.fromisoformat(message.timestamp)
 238:             current_time = datetime.now()
 239:             time_diff = (current_time - message_time).total_seconds()
 240: 
 241:             if time_diff > message.ttl:
 242:                 logger.warning(f"Message {message.id} expirÃ© (TTL: {message.ttl}s)")
 243:                 return
 244: 
 245:             logger.info(f"Message reÃ§u: {message.id} de {message.sender} (type: {message.message_type})")
 246: 
 247:             # Appeler les handlers
 248:             handlers = self.message_handlers.get(message.message_type, [])
 249:             for handler in handlers:
 250:                 try:
 251:                     handler(message)
 252:                 except Exception as e:
 253:                     logger.error(f"Erreur dans le handler {handler.__name__}: {e}")
 254: 
 255:             # Mettre en cache
 256:             self.message_cache[message.id] = message
 257: 
 258:             # Nettoyer le cache si nÃ©cessaire
 259:             if len(self.message_cache) > 1000:
 260:                 self._cleanup_cache()
 261: 
 262:         except Exception as e:
 263:             logger.error(f"Erreur dans _process_message: {e}")
 264: 
 265:     def _handle_request(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 266:         """Traite une requÃªte RPC"""
 267:         request_type = request.get("type", "").lower()
 268: 
 269:         try:
 270:             if request_type == "subscribe":
 271:                 return self._handle_subscribe(request)
 272:             elif request_type == "unsubscribe":
 273:                 return self._handle_unsubscribe(request)
 274:             elif request_type == "get_status":
 275:                 return self._handle_status(request)
 276:             elif request_type == "search_messages":
 277:                 return self._handle_search(request)
 278:             elif request_type == "ping":
 279:                 return {"status": "ok", "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()}
 280:             else:
 281:                 return {
 282:                     "status": "error",
 283:                     "message": f"Type de requÃªte inconnu: {request_type}"
 284:                 }
 285:         except Exception as e:
 286:             logger.error(f"Erreur traitement requÃªte {request_type}: {e}")
 287:             return {
 288:                 "status": "error",
 289:                 "message": f"Erreur interne: {str(e)}"
 290:             }
 291: 
 292:     def _handle_subscribe(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 293:         """GÃ¨re une souscription"""
 294:         agent_id = request.get("agent_id")
 295:         message_types = request.get("message_types", [])
 296: 
 297:         if not agent_id:
 298:             return {"status": "error", "message": "agent_id requis"}
 299: 
 300:         if agent_id not in self.subscribers:
 301:             self.subscribers[agent_id] = []
 302: 
 303:         added_types = []
 304:         for msg_type in message_types:
 305:             if msg_type not in self.subscribers[agent_id]:
 306:                 self.subscribers[agent_id].append(msg_type)
 307:                 added_types.append(msg_type)
 308: 
 309:         logger.info(f"Agent {agent_id} souscrit Ã : {added_types}")
 310: 
 311:         return {
 312:             "status": "success",
 313:             "agent_id": agent_id,
 314:             "subscribed_to": self.subscribers[agent_id],
 315:             "added": added_types
 316:         }
 317: 
 318:     def _handle_unsubscribe(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 319:         """GÃ¨re un dÃ©sabonnement"""
 320:         agent_id = request.get("agent_id")
 321:         message_types = request.get("message_types", [])
 322: 
 323:         if agent_id not in self.subscribers:
 324:             return {"status": "error", "message": f"Agent {agent_id} non trouvÃ©"}
 325: 
 326:         removed_types = []
 327:         for msg_type in message_types:
 328:             if msg_type in self.subscribers[agent_id]:
 329:                 self.subscribers[agent_id].remove(msg_type)
 330:                 removed_types.append(msg_type)
 331: 
 332:         # Si plus d'abonnements, supprimer l'agent
 333:         if not self.subscribers[agent_id]:
 334:             del self.subscribers[agent_id]
 335: 
 336:         return {
 337:             "status": "success",
 338:             "removed": removed_types,
 339:             "remaining": self.subscribers.get(agent_id, [])
 340:         }
 341: 
 342:     def _handle_status(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 343:         """Retourne le statut du bus"""
 344:         return {
 345:             "status": "running" if self.running else "stopped",
 346:             "subscribers_count": len(self.subscribers),
 347:             "cached_messages": len(self.message_cache),
 348:             "host": self.host,
 349:             "port": self.pub_port,
 350:             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
 351:         }
 352: 
 353:     def _handle_search(self, request: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 354:         """Recherche dans les messages en cache"""
 355:         search_term = request.get("search", "").lower()
 356:         sender_filter = request.get("sender")
 357:         message_type_filter = request.get("message_type")
 358:         limit = min(request.get("limit", 50), 100)  # Max 100 rÃ©sultats
 359: 
 360:         results = []
 361:         for msg_id, message in self.message_cache.items():
 362:             # Appliquer les filtres
 363:             if sender_filter and message.sender != sender_filter:
 364:                 continue
 365:             if message_type_filter and message.message_type != message_type_filter:
 366:                 continue
 367: 
 368:             # Recherche dans le contenu
 369:             content_str = json.dumps(message.content).lower()
 370:             if search_term in content_str or search_term in message.message_type.lower():
 371:                 results.append(message.to_dict())
 372: 
 373:             if len(results) >= limit:
 374:                 break
 375: 
 376:         return {
 377:             "status": "success",
 378:             "count": len(results),
 379:             "results": results,
 380:             "search_term": search_term
 381:         }
 382: 
 383:     def _cleanup_cache(self):
 384:         """Nettoie le cache des messages"""
 385:         current_time = datetime.now()
 386:         expired_ids = []
 387: 
 388:         for msg_id, message in self.message_cache.items():
 389:             message_time = datetime.fromisoformat(message.timestamp)
 390:             time_diff = (current_time - message_time).total_seconds()
 391: 
 392:             if time_diff > message.ttl:
 393:                 expired_ids.append(msg_id)
 394: 
 395:         # Supprimer les messages expirÃ©s
 396:         for msg_id in expired_ids:
 397:             del self.message_cache[msg_id]
 398: 
 399:         # Limiter la taille du cache
 400:         if len(self.message_cache) > 800:
 401:             # Garder les 800 messages les plus rÃ©cents
 402:             sorted_messages = sorted(
 403:                 self.message_cache.items(),
 404:                 key=lambda x: x[1].timestamp,
 405:                 reverse=True
 406:             )[:800]
 407:             self.message_cache = dict(sorted_messages)
 408: 
 409:     def publish(self, message: Message) -> bool:
 410:         """Publie un message sur le bus"""
 411:         if not self.running or not self.publisher:
 412:             logger.error("Bus non dÃ©marrÃ© ou socket non disponible")
 413:             return False
 414: 
 415:         try:
 416:             # S'assurer que le message a un ID et timestamp
 417:             if not message.id:
 418:                 message.id = str(uuid.uuid4())
 419:             if not message.timestamp:
 420:                 message.timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
 421: 
 422:             # Convertir en JSON
 423:             message_data = json.dumps(message.to_dict())
 424: 
 425:             # Publier le message
 426:             self.publisher.send_string(message.message_type, zmq.SNDMORE)
 427:             self.publisher.send_json(message.to_dict())
 428: 
 429:             logger.debug(f"Message publiÃ©: {message.id} (type: {message.message_type})")
 430: 
 431:             # Mettre en cache
 432:             self.message_cache[message.id] = message
 433: 
 434:             return True
 435: 
 436:         except Exception as e:
 437:             logger.error(f"Erreur lors de la publication: {e}")
 438:             return False
 439: 
 440:     def subscribe(self, agent_id: str, message_types: List[str],
 441:                   handler: Optional[Callable] = None) -> bool:
 442:         """Souscrit un agent Ã  des types de messages"""
 443:         try:
 444:             # Enregistrer dans les subscribers
 445:             if agent_id not in self.subscribers:
 446:                 self.subscribers[agent_id] = []
 447: 
 448:             for msg_type in message_types:
 449:                 if msg_type not in self.subscribers[agent_id]:
 450:                     self.subscribers[agent_id].append(msg_type)
 451: 
 452:             # Enregistrer le handler
 453:             if handler:
 454:                 for msg_type in message_types:
 455:                     if msg_type not in self.message_handlers:
 456:                         self.message_handlers[msg_type] = []
 457:                     if handler not in self.message_handlers[msg_type]:
 458:                         self.message_handlers[msg_type].append(handler)
 459: 
 460:             logger.info(f"Agent {agent_id} souscrit Ã  {len(message_types)} type(s) de messages")
 461:             return True
 462: 
 463:         except Exception as e:
 464:             logger.error(f"Erreur lors de la souscription: {e}")
 465:             return False
 466: 
 467:     def add_message_handler(self, message_type: str, handler: Callable):
 468:         """Ajoute un handler pour un type de message spÃ©cifique"""
 469:         if message_type not in self.message_handlers:
 470:             self.message_handlers[message_type] = []
 471: 
 472:         if handler not in self.message_handlers[message_type]:
 473:             self.message_handlers[message_type].append(handler)
 474:             logger.debug(f"Handler ajoutÃ© pour le type: {message_type}")
 475: 
 476:     def remove_message_handler(self, message_type: str, handler: Callable):
 477:         """Supprime un handler"""
 478:         if message_type in self.message_handlers:
 479:             if handler in self.message_handlers[message_type]:
 480:                 self.message_handlers[message_type].remove(handler)
 481:                 logger.debug(f"Handler supprimÃ© pour le type: {message_type}")

 156:                 "frontend_ready": True,
 157:                 "tech_stack": {
 158:                     "framework": random.choice(self.frameworks),
 159:                     "web3": random.choice(self.web3_libraries),
 160:                     "styling": random.choice(self.ui_libraries),
 161:                     "testing": "Jest + React Testing Library + Cypress",
 162:                     "build_tool": "Vite",

 164:                 },

 168:                     "tools": ["React DevTools", "Redux DevTools", "Wallet DevTools"]
 169:                 }
 170:             }
 171: 
 172:         return {
 173:             "status": "success",
 174:             "agent": self.name,
 175:             "task": task_type,
 176:             "result": result,
 177:             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
 178:         }
 179: 
 180:     def _select_framework(self, requirements: str) -> str:
 181:         """SÃ©lectionne le framework appropriÃ©"""
 182:         requirements_lower = requirements.lower()
 183: 
 184:         if "seo" in requirements_lower or "ssr" in requirements_lower:
 185:             return "Next.js"
 186:         elif "fast" in requirements_lower or "lightweight" in requirements_lower:
 187:             return "Vue"
 188:         elif "enterprise" in requirements_lower or "scalable" in requirements_lower:
 189:             return "Angular"
 190:         elif "reactive" in requirements_lower or "compiler" in requirements_lower:
 191:             return "Svelte"
 192:         else:
 193:             return "React"
 194:

 388:     def _generate_component_code(self, component_type: str) -> str:
 389:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re le code d'un composant"""
 390:         if component_type == "ConnectWallet":
 391:             return '''import React, { useState } from 'react';
 392: import { useAccount, useConnect, useDisconnect } from 'wagmi';
 393: import { MetaMaskConnector } from 'wagmi/connectors/metaMask';
 394: import { WalletConnectConnector } from 'wagmi/connectors/walletConnect';
 395: import { CoinbaseWalletConnector } from 'wagmi/connectors/coinbaseWallet';
 396: import {
 397:   Button,
 398:   Modal,
 399:   Stack,
 400:   Text,
 401:   Avatar,
 402:   Box,
 403:   useDisclosure
 404: } from '@chakra-ui/react';
 405: 
 406: interface ConnectWalletButtonProps {
 407:   variant?: 'primary' | 'outline' | 'ghost';
 408:   size?: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg';
 409:   onConnect?: (address: string) => void;
 410:   onDisconnect?: () => void;
 411: }
 412: 
 413: const ConnectWalletButton: React.FC<ConnectWalletButtonProps> = ({
 414:   variant = 'primary',
 415:   size = 'md',
 416:   onConnect,
 417:   onDisconnect
 418: }) => {
 419:   const { isOpen, onOpen, onClose } = useDisclosure();
 420:   const { address, isConnected } = useAccount();
 421:   const { connect, connectors, error, isLoading, pendingConnector } = useConnect({
 422:     onSuccess: (data) => {
 423:       onConnect?.(data.account);
 424:       onClose();
 425:     }
 426:   });
 427:   const { disconnect } = useDisconnect({
 428:     onSuccess: () => {
 429:       onDisconnect?.();
 430:     }
 431:   });
 432: 
 433:   const formatAddress = (addr: string) => {
 434:     return `${addr.slice(0, 6)}...${addr.slice(-4)}`;
 435:   };
 436: 
 437:   const connectorsList = [
 438:     {
 439:       connector: new MetaMaskConnector(),
 440:       name: 'MetaMask',
 441:       icon: 'ğŸ¦Š',
 442:       description: 'Connect using MetaMask browser extension'
 443:     },
 444:     {
 445:       connector: new WalletConnectConnector({
 446:         options: {
 447:           projectId: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_WALLETCONNECT_PROJECT_ID,
 448:         }
 449:       }),
 450:       name: 'WalletConnect',
 451:       icon: 'ğŸ“±',
 452:       description: 'Scan QR code with mobile wallet'
 453:     },
 454:     {
 455:       connector: new CoinbaseWalletConnector({
 456:         options: {
 457:           appName: 'MyWeb3App',
 458:           jsonRpcUrl: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_RPC_URL
 459:         }
 460:       }),
 461:       name: 'Coinbase Wallet',
 462:       icon: 'ğŸ’°',
 463:       description: 'Connect using Coinbase Wallet'
 464:     }
 465:   ];
 466: 
 467:   if (isConnected && address) {
 468:     return (
 469:       <Button
 470:         variant={variant}
 471:         size={size}
 472:         onClick={() => disconnect()}
 473:         leftIcon={<Avatar size="xs" src="/metamask.svg" />}
 474:         rightIcon={<Box w="2" h="2" bg="green.500" borderRadius="full" />}
 475:       >
 476:         {formatAddress(address)}
 477:       </Button>
 478:     );
 479:   }
 480: 
 481:   return (
 482:     <>
 483:       <Button
 484:         variant={variant}
 485:         size={size}
 486:         onClick={onOpen}
 487:         isLoading={isLoading}
 488:         loadingText="Connecting..."
 489:       >
 490:         Connect Wallet
 491:       </Button>
 492: 
 493:       <Modal isOpen={isOpen} onClose={onClose} size="md">
 494:         <Modal.Overlay />
 495:         <Modal.Content>
 496:           <Modal.Header>
 497:             <Text fontSize="xl" fontWeight="bold">
 498:               Connect Wallet
 499:             </Text>
 500:             <Text fontSize="sm" color="gray.600" mt={1}>
 501:               Choose your preferred wallet to connect
 502:             </Text>
 503:           </Modal.Header>
 504:           <Modal.Body>
 505:             <Stack spacing={4}>
 506:               {connectorsList.map(({ connector, name, icon, description }) => (
 507:                 <Button
 508:                   key={name}
 509:                   variant="outline"
 510:                   size="lg"
 511:                   justifyContent="flex-start"
 512:                   onClick={() => connect({ connector })}
 513:                   isLoading={isLoading && pendingConnector?.id === connector.id}
 514:                   leftIcon={
 515:                     <Text fontSize="xl">{icon}</Text>
 516:                   }
 517:                   isDisabled={!connector.ready}
 518:                 >
 519:                   <Box textAlign="left">
 520:                     <Text fontWeight="semibold">{name}</Text>
 521:                     <Text fontSize="sm" color="gray.600">
 522:                       {description}
 523:                     </Text>
 524:                   </Box>
 525:                 </Button>
 526:               ))}
 527:             </Stack>
 528: 
 529:             {error && (
 530:               <Box mt={4} p={3} bg="red.50" borderRadius="md">
 531:                 <Text color="red.600" fontSize="sm">
 532:                   {error.message}
 533:                 </Text>
 534:               </Box>
 535:             )}
 536:           </Modal.Body>
 537:         </Modal.Content>
 538:       </Modal>
 539:     </>
 540:   );
 541: };
 542: 
 543: export default ConnectWalletButton;'''
 544: 
 545:         else:
 546:             return '''// Composant gÃ©nÃ©rique
 547: const Web3Component = () => {
 548:   return (
 549:     <div>
 550:       <h1>Composant Web3</h1>
 551:     </div>
 552:   );
 553: };
 554: 
 555: export default Web3Component;'''
 556: 
 557:     def _get_component_props(self, component_type: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 558:         """Retourne les props d'un composant"""
 559:         props_map = {
 560:             "ConnectWallet": [
 561:                 {"name": "variant", "type": "string", "default": "primary", "description": "Variant du bouton"},
 562:                 {"name": "size", "type": "string", "default": "md", "description": "Taille du bouton"},
 563:                 {"name": "onConnect", "type": "function", "required": False, "description": "Callback aprÃ¨s connexion"},
 564:                 {"name": "onDisconnect", "type": "function", "required": False, "description": "Callback aprÃ¨s dÃ©connexion"}
 565:             ],
 566:             "NetworkSwitcher": [
 567:                 {"name": "currentNetwork", "type": "object", "required": True, "description": "RÃ©seau actuel"},
 568:                 {"name": "availableNetworks", "type": "array", "required": True, "description": "RÃ©seaux disponibles"},
 569:                 {"name": "onSwitch", "type": "function", "required": True, "description": "Callback pour changer de rÃ©seau"}
 570:             ]
 571:         }
 572: 
 573:         return props_map.get(component_type, [
 574:             {"name": "children", "type": "ReactNode", "description": "Contenu du composant"}
 575:         ])
 576: 
 577:     def _get_component_dependencies(self, component_type: str) -> List[str]:
 578:         """Retourne les dÃ©pendances d'un composant"""
 579:         deps_map = {
 580:             "ConnectWallet": ["wagmi", "viem", "@chakra-ui/react", "react"],
 581:             "NetworkSwitcher": ["wagmi", "viem", "@chakra-ui/react", "react"],
 582:             "TransactionHistory": ["wagmi", "viem", "@tanstack/react-table", "date-fns", "react"]
 583:         }
 584: 
 585:         return deps_map.get(component_type, ["react"])
 586: 
 587:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 588:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© de l'agent frontend Web3"""
 589:         base_health = await super().health_check()
 590:         return {
 591:             **base_health,
 592:             "frameworks": self.frameworks,
 593:             "web3_libraries": self.web3_libraries,
 594:             "wallets_supported": len(self.wallets),
 595:             "ui_libraries": self.ui_libraries,
 596:             "dapps_created": self.config.get("dapps_created", 8),
 597:             "components_developed": self.config.get("components_developed", 42),
 598:             "performance_score": f"{random.randint(85, 100)}/100"
 599:         }

   5: from typing import Dict, Any

   8: 
   9: class ReactExpertSubAgent:
  10:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en React/Next.js"""
  11: 
  12:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = ""):
  13:         self.config_path = config_path
  14:         self.config = self._load_config()
  15:         self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  16:         self.agent_id = f"react_expert_sub_01"
  17: 
  18:         self.logger.info(f"Sous-agent {self.agent_id} initialisÃ©")
  19: 
  20:     def _load_config(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  21:         """Charge la configuration"""
  22:         if self.config_path and os.path.exists(self.config_path):
  23:             try:
  24:                 with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
  25:                     return yaml.safe_load(f)
  26:             except Exception as e:
  27:                 self.logger.error(f"Erreur de chargement config: {e}")
  28: 
  29:         # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  30:         return {
  31:             "agent": {
  32:                 "name": "React/Next.js",
  33:                 "specialization": "React/Next.js",
  34:                 "version": "1.0.0"
  35:             },
  36:             "capabilities": ["task_execution", "specialized_operation"]
  37:         }
  38: 
  39:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  40:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che spÃ©cialisÃ©e"""
  41:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "unknown")
  42: 
  43:         self.logger.info(f"ExÃ©cution de la tÃ¢che {task_type}")
  44: 
  45:         # ImplÃ©mentation spÃ©cifique au sous-agent
  46:         result = await self._execute_specialized(task_data, context)
  47: 
  48:         return {
  49:             "success": True,
  50:             "sub_agent": "react_expert",
  51:             "task": task_type,
  52:             "result": result,
  53:             "specialization": "React/Next.js"
  54:         }
  55: 
  56:     async def _execute_specialized(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  57:         """MÃ©thode spÃ©cialisÃ©e Ã  implÃ©menter"""
  58:         # Ã€ implÃ©menter selon la spÃ©cialisation
  59:         return {
  60:             "message": "TÃ¢che exÃ©cutÃ©e par le sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ©",
  61:             "specialization": "React/Next.js",
  62:             "input": task_data
  63:         }
  64: 
  65:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  66:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© du sous-agent"""
  67:         return {
  68:             "agent": "react_expert",
  69:             "status": "healthy",
  70:             "type": "sub_agent",
  71:             "specialization": "React/Next.js",
  72:             "config_loaded": bool(self.config)
  73:         }
  74:
