FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\learning\collective_learning.py
   1: # learning/collective_learning.py
   2: import hashlib
   3: from typing import Dict, List
   4: from pathlib import Path
   5: 
   6: class CollectiveLearningSystem:
   7:     """SystÃ¨me d'apprentissage partagÃ© basÃ© sur fichiers"""
   8: 
   9:     def __init__(self, knowledge_base_path: Path):
  10:         self.knowledge_base = knowledge_base_path
  11:         self.knowledge_base.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  12: 
  13:         # Sous-rÃ©pertoires
  14:         self.patterns_dir = self.knowledge_base / "patterns"
  15:         self.solutions_dir = self.knowledge_base / "solutions"
  16:         self.mistakes_dir = self.knowledge_base / "mistakes"
  17:         self.best_practices_dir = self.knowledge_base / "best_practices"
  18: 
  19:         for dir in [self.patterns_dir, self.solutions_dir,
  20:                    self.mistakes_dir, self.best_practices_dir]:
  21:             dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  22: 
  23:     def store_solution(self, problem_hash: str, solution: Dict, agent_id: str):
  24:         """Stocke une solution Ã  un problÃ¨me"""
  25:         solution_file = self.solutions_dir / f"{problem_hash}.json"
  26: 
  27:         data = {
  28:             "problem_hash": problem_hash,
  29:             "solution": solution,
  30:             "agent": agent_id,
  31:             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
  32:             "effectiveness": 1.0,  # Sera mis Ã  jour avec le feedback
  33:             "usage_count": 1
  34:         }
  35: 
  36:         if solution_file.exists():
  37:             # Mise Ã  jour du compteur d'utilisation
  38:             with open(solution_file, "r") as f:
  39:                 existing = json.load(f)
  40:                 existing["usage_count"] += 1
  41: 
  42:             data = existing
  43: 
  44:         with open(solution_file, "w") as f:
  45:             json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
  46: 
  47:     def find_similar_solutions(self, problem_description: str,
  48:                               threshold: float = 0.8) -> List[Dict]:
  49:         """Trouve des solutions similaires"""
  50:         problem_hash = self._hash_description(problem_description)
  51: 
  52:         solutions = []
  53:         for solution_file in self.solutions_dir.glob("*.json"):
  54:             with open(solution_file, "r") as f:
  55:                 solution_data = json.load(f)
  56: 
  57:                 # Calcul de similaritÃ© basique
  58:                 similarity = self._calculate_similarity(
  59:                     problem_hash,
  60:                     solution_data["problem_hash"]
  61:                 )
  62: 
  63:                 if similarity >= threshold:
  64:                     solutions.append(solution_data)
  65: 
  66:         return sorted(solutions, key=lambda x: x["effectiveness"], reverse=True)
  67: 
  68:     def learn_from_mistake(self, agent_id: str, task: Dict,
  69:                           error: str, correction: Dict):
  70:         """Apprend d'une erreur et la partage"""
  71:         mistake_id = f"{agent_id}_{datetime.now().timestamp()}"
  72:         mistake_file = self.mistakes_dir / f"{mistake_id}.json"
  73: 
  74:         with open(mistake_file, "w") as f:
  75:             json.dump({
  76:                 "agent": agent_id,
  77:                 "task": task,
  78:                 "error": error,
  79:                 "correction": correction,
  80:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
  81:                 "learned_by": [agent_id]  # Liste des agents ayant appris
  82:             }, f, indent=2)
  83: 
  84:         # Notifie les autres agents
  85:         self._broadcast_learning(agent_id, "mistake_learned", mistake_id)
  86: 
  87:     def _broadcast_learning(self, from_agent: str, learning_type: str,
  88:                           content_id: str):
  89:         """Diffuse un apprentissage Ã  tous les agents"""
  90:         learning_event = {
  91:             "type": learning_type,
  92:             "from": from_agent,
  93:             "content_id": content_id,
  94:             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat()
  95:         }
  96: 
  97:         # Ã‰crit dans un fichier partagÃ© que tous les agents lisent
  98:         event_file = self.knowledge_base / "learning_events.jsonl"
  99: 
 100:         with open(event_file, "a") as f:
 101:             f.write(json.dumps(learning_event) + "\n")
 102: 
 103:     @staticmethod
 104:     def _hash_description(description: str) -> str:
 105:         """Hash une description pour comparaison"""
 106:         return hashlib.md5(description.encode()).hexdigest()[:10]
 107: 
 108:     @staticmethod
 109:     def _calculate_similarity(hash1: str, hash2: str) -> float:
 110:         """Calcule la similaritÃ© entre deux hashes"""
 111:         # Simple similaritÃ© de Levenshtein normalisÃ©e
 112:         from Levenshtein import distance
 113:         max_len = max(len(hash1), len(hash2))
 114:         if max_len == 0:
 115:             return 1.0
 116:         return 1 - distance(hash1, hash2) / max_len

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\monitoring\dashboard_config.yaml
   1: # monitoring/dashboard_config.yaml
   2: dashboard:
   3:   name: "Smart Contract Safety Dashboard"
   4:   refresh_interval: 30  # secondes
   5: 
   6:   widgets:
   7:     - type: "formal_verification_status"
   8:       title: "Preuves Formelles"
   9:       metrics:
  10:         - "proofs_completed"
  11:         - "proofs_pending"
  12:         - "verification_score"
  13: 
  14:     - type: "fuzzing_coverage"
  15:       title: "Couverture Fuzzing"
  16:       metrics:
  17:         - "branch_coverage"
  18:         - "state_coverage"
  19:         - "edge_cases_found"
  20: 
  21:     - type: "gas_optimization"
  22:       title: "Optimisation Gas"
  23:       metrics:
  24:         - "gas_saved_vs_baseline"
  25:         - "worst_case_gas"
  26:         - "average_gas"
  27: 
  28:     - type: "security_scan"
  29:       title: "Scans SÃ©curitÃ©"
  30:       metrics:
  31:         - "critical_vulnerabilities"
  32:         - "high_vulnerabilities"
  33:         - "slither_score"
  34: 
  35:     - type: "multi_chain_compatibility"
  36:       title: "CompatibilitÃ© Multi-ChaÃ®ne"
  37:       metrics:
  38:         - "ethereum_compatibility"
  39:         - "l2_compatibility"
  40:         - "testnet_deployments"
  41: 
  42:   alerts:
  43:     - trigger: "new_vulnerability_found"
  44:       severity: "critical"
  45:       action: "pause_pipeline"
  46: 
  47:     - trigger: "proof_failed"
  48:       severity: "high"
  49:       action: "auto_correct"
  50: 
  51:     - trigger: "gas_limit_exceeded"
  52:       severity: "medium"
  53:       action: "optimize_retry"
  54: 
  55:     - trigger: "test_coverage_below_95"
  56:       severity: "low"
  57:       action: "generate_more_tests"

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\smart_contract\agent.py
   1: """
   2: Agent Smart Contract - DÃ©veloppement de contrats intelligents
   3: Version complÃ¨te et corrigÃ©e
   4: """
   5: from .base_agent import BaseAgent
   6: from typing import Dict, Any, List
   7: from datetime import datetime
   8: import random
   9: 
  10: class SmartContractAgent(BaseAgent):
  11:     """Agent principal pour le dÃ©veloppement de smart contracts"""
  12: 
  13:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = None):
  14:         super().__init__(config_path, "SmartContractAgent")
  15:         self.blockchains = self.config.get("blockchains", ["Ethereum", "Polygon", "Arbitrum", "BNB Chain", "Avalanche"])
  16:         self.standards = self.config.get("standards", ["ERC-20", "ERC-721", "ERC-1155", "ERC-4626"])
  17:         self.security_level = self.config.get("security_level", "high")
  18:         self.tools = self.config.get("tools", ["Hardhat", "Foundry", "Truffle", "Brownie"])
  19: 
  20:         # Ajout des capacitÃ©s
  21:         self.add_capability("contract_development")
  22:         self.add_capability("security_audit")
  23:         self.add_capability("gas_optimization")
  24:         self.add_capability("contract_deployment")
  25:         self.add_capability("testing")
  26: 
  27:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  28:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che de smart contract"""
  29:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "contract_development")

 134: 
 135:     def _generate_contract(self, contract_type: str) -> str:
 136:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re un smart contract Solidity"""
 137: 
 138:         if contract_type == "ERC20":
 139:             return '''// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 140: pragma solidity ^0.8.19;
 141: 
 142: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol";
 143: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";
 144: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/security/Pausable.sol";
 145: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/security/ReentrancyGuard.sol";
 146: 
 147: /**
 148:  * @title MyToken
 149:  * @dev ERC20 token with minting, burning, and pausable functionality
 150:  */
 151: contract MyToken is ERC20, Ownable, Pausable, ReentrancyGuard {
 152:     uint256 public constant MAX_SUPPLY = 100_000_000 * 10 ** 18; // 100 million tokens
 153:     uint256 public constant INITIAL_SUPPLY = 10_000_000 * 10 ** 18; // 10 million tokens
 154: 
 155:     mapping(address => uint256) private _vesting;
 156: 
 157:     event TokensMinted(address indexed to, uint256 amount);
 158:     event TokensBurned(address indexed from, uint256 amount);
 159:     event VestingAdded(address indexed beneficiary, uint256 amount, uint256 releaseTime);
 160:     event VestingReleased(address indexed beneficiary, uint256 amount);
 161: 
 162:     /**
 163:      * @dev Constructor that initializes the token
 164:      * @param name Token name
 165:      * @param symbol Token symbol
 166:      */
 167:     constructor(string memory name, string memory symbol) ERC20(name, symbol) {
 168:         _mint(msg.sender, INITIAL_SUPPLY);
 169:     }
 170: 
 171:     /**
 172:      * @dev Mint new tokens (owner only)
 173:      * @param to Address to mint to
 174:      * @param amount Amount to mint
 175:      */
 176:     function mint(address to, uint256 amount)
 177:         external
 178:         onlyOwner
 179:         whenNotPaused
 180:         nonReentrant
 181:     {
 182:         require(totalSupply() + amount <= MAX_SUPPLY, "Exceeds max supply");
 183:         _mint(to, amount);
 184:         emit TokensMinted(to, amount);
 185:     }
 186: 
 187:     /**
 188:      * @dev Burn tokens from caller
 189:      * @param amount Amount to burn
 190:      */
 191:     function burn(uint256 amount)
 192:         external
 193:         whenNotPaused
 194:         nonReentrant
 195:     {
 196:         _burn(msg.sender, amount);
 197:         emit TokensBurned(msg.sender, amount);
 198:     }
 199: 
 200:     /**
 201:      * @dev Add vesting for a beneficiary
 202:      * @param beneficiary Address to vest for
 203:      * @param amount Amount to vest
 204:      * @param releaseTime Unix timestamp when tokens become claimable
 205:      */
 206:     function addVesting(
 207:         address beneficiary,
 208:         uint256 amount,
 209:         uint256 releaseTime
 210:     )
 211:         external
 212:         onlyOwner
 213:         whenNotPaused
 214:         nonReentrant
 215:     {
 216:         require(beneficiary != address(0), "Invalid beneficiary");
 217:         require(amount > 0, "Amount must be positive");
 218:         require(releaseTime > block.timestamp, "Release time must be in future");
 219:         require(balanceOf(msg.sender) >= amount, "Insufficient balance");
 220: 
 221:         _vesting[beneficiary] = amount;
 222:         _transfer(msg.sender, address(this), amount);
 223: 
 224:         emit VestingAdded(beneficiary, amount, releaseTime);
 225:     }
 226: 
 227:     /**
 228:      * @dev Release vested tokens
 229:      */
 230:     function releaseVested()
 231:         external
 232:         whenNotPaused
 233:         nonReentrant
 234:     {
 235:         uint256 amount = _vesting[msg.sender];
 236:         require(amount > 0, "No vested tokens");
 237:         require(block.timestamp >= _vesting[msg.sender], "Vesting not yet released");
 238: 
 239:         _vesting[msg.sender] = 0;
 240:         _transfer(address(this), msg.sender, amount);
 241: 
 242:         emit VestingReleased(msg.sender, amount);
 243:     }
 244: 
 245:     /**
 246:      * @dev Pause all token transfers (owner only)
 247:      */
 248:     function pause() external onlyOwner {
 249:         _pause();
 250:     }
 251: 
 252:     /**
 253:      * @dev Unpause token transfers (owner only)
 254:      */
 255:     function unpause() external onlyOwner {
 256:         _unpause();
 257:     }
 258: 
 259:     /**
 260:      * @dev Get vested amount for an address
 261:      * @param beneficiary Address to check
 262:      * @return vestedAmount Vested token amount
 263:      */
 264:     function getVestedAmount(address beneficiary) external view returns (uint256) {
 265:         return _vesting[beneficiary];
 266:     }
 267: }'''
 268: 
 269:         elif contract_type == "ERC721":
 270:             return '''// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 271: pragma solidity ^0.8.19;
 272: 
 273: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol";
 274: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";
 275: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/security/Pausable.sol";
 276: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Counters.sol";
 277: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol";
 278: 
 279: /**
 280:  * @title MyNFT
 281:  * @dev ERC721 NFT collection with metadata, royalties, and reveal functionality
 282:  */
 283: contract MyNFT is ERC721, Ownable, Pausable {
 284:     using Counters for Counters.Counter;
 285:     using Strings for uint256;
 286: 
 287:     Counters.Counter private _tokenIdCounter;
 288: 
 289:     string private _baseTokenURI;
 290:     string private _unrevealedURI;
 291:     bool private _revealed;
 292: 
 293:     uint256 public constant MAX_SUPPLY = 10000;
 294:     uint256 public constant MAX_MINT_PER_TX = 10;
 295:     uint256 public constant PRICE = 0.08 ether;
 296: 
 297:     mapping(uint256 => string) private _tokenURIs;
 298:     mapping(address => uint256) private _mintedCount;
 299: 
 300:     event NFTMinted(address indexed to, uint256 tokenId);
 301:     event CollectionRevealed(string baseURI);
 302:     event MetadataUpdated(uint256 tokenId, string newURI);
 303: 
 304:     /**
 305:      * @dev Constructor
 306:      * @param name NFT collection name
 307:      * @param symbol NFT collection symbol
 308:      * @param unrevealedURI URI for unrevealed tokens
 309:      */
 310:     constructor(
 311:         string memory name,
 312:         string memory symbol,
 313:         string memory unrevealedURI
 314:     ) ERC721(name, symbol) {
 315:         _unrevealedURI = unrevealedURI;
 316:         _revealed = false;
 317:     }
 318: 
 319:     /**
 320:      * @dev Mint NFTs (public)
 321:      * @param to Address to mint to
 322:      * @param quantity Number of NFTs to mint
 323:      */
 324:     function mint(address to, uint256 quantity)
 325:         external
 326:         payable
 327:         whenNotPaused
 328:     {
 329:         require(quantity > 0 && quantity <= MAX_MINT_PER_TX, "Invalid quantity");
 330:         require(msg.value >= PRICE * quantity, "Insufficient payment");
 331:         require(_tokenIdCounter.current() + quantity <= MAX_SUPPLY, "Exceeds max supply");
 332:         require(_mintedCount[to] + quantity <= MAX_MINT_PER_TX, "Exceeds personal limit");
 333: 
 334:         for (uint256 i = 0; i < quantity; i++) {
 335:             _tokenIdCounter.increment();
 336:             uint256 tokenId = _tokenIdCounter.current();
 337: 
 338:             _safeMint(to, tokenId);
 339:             _mintedCount[to]++;
 340: 
 341:             emit NFTMinted(to, tokenId);
 342:         }
 343: 
 344:         // Refund excess payment
 345:         if (msg.value > PRICE * quantity) {
 346:             payable(msg.sender).transfer(msg.value - PRICE * quantity);
 347:         }
 348:     }
 349: 
 350:     /**
 351:      * @dev Reveal the collection with final metadata
 352:      * @param baseURI Base URI for revealed tokens
 353:      */
 354:     function reveal(string memory baseURI) external onlyOwner {
 355:         require(!_revealed, "Already revealed");
 356:         _baseTokenURI = baseURI;
 357:         _revealed = true;
 358: 
 359:         emit CollectionRevealed(baseURI);
 360:     }
 361: 
 362:     /**
 363:      * @dev Set token metadata (owner only, for special cases)
 364:      * @param tokenId Token ID
 365:      * @param tokenURI Custom token URI
 366:      */
 367:     function setTokenURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory tokenURI)
 368:         external
 369:         onlyOwner
 370:     {
 371:         require(_exists(tokenId), "Token doesn't exist");
 372:         _tokenURIs[tokenId] = tokenURI;
 373: 
 374:         emit MetadataUpdated(tokenId, tokenURI);
 375:     }
 376: 
 377:     /**
 378:      * @dev Get token URI
 379:      * @param tokenId Token ID
 380:      * @return Token URI string
 381:      */
 382:     function tokenURI(uint256 tokenId)
 383:         public
 384:         view
 385:         virtual
 386:         override
 387:         returns (string memory)
 388:     {
 389:         require(_exists(tokenId), "ERC721Metadata: URI query for nonexistent token");
 390: 
 391:         if (!_revealed) {
 392:             return _unrevealedURI;
 393:         }
 394: 
 395:         if (bytes(_tokenURIs[tokenId]).length > 0) {
 396:             return _tokenURIs[tokenId];
 397:         }
 398: 
 399:         return string(abi.encodePacked(_baseTokenURI, tokenId.toString(), ".json"));
 400:     }
 401: 
 402:     /**
 403:      * @dev Get total minted count
 404:      * @return Total tokens minted
 405:      */
 406:     function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256) {
 407:         return _tokenIdCounter.current();
 408:     }
 409: 
 410:     /**
 411:      * @dev Get minted count for an address
 412:      * @param account Address to check
 413:      * @return Number of NFTs minted by account
 414:      */
 415:     function getMintedCount(address account) external view returns (uint256) {
 416:         return _mintedCount[account];
 417:     }
 418: 
 419:     /**
 420:      * @dev Withdraw contract balance (owner only)
 421:      */
 422:     function withdraw() external onlyOwner {
 423:         uint256 balance = address(this).balance;
 424:         require(balance > 0, "No balance to withdraw");
 425: 
 426:         payable(owner()).transfer(balance);
 427:     }
 428: 
 429:     /**
 430:      * @dev Pause minting (owner only)
 431:      */
 432:     function pause() external onlyOwner {
 433:         _pause();
 434:     }
 435: 
 436:     /**
 437:      * @dev Unpause minting (owner only)
 438:      */
 439:     function unpause() external onlyOwner {
 440:         _unpause();
 441:     }
 442: }'''
 443: 
 444:         elif contract_type == "Staking":
 445:             return '''// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 446: pragma solidity ^0.8.19;
 447: 
 448: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol";
 449: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol";
 450: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";
 451: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/security/ReentrancyGuard.sol";
 452: import "@openzeppelin/contracts/security/Pausable.sol";
 453: 
 454: /**
 455:  * @title StakingRewards
 456:  * @dev Staking contract with rewards distribution
 457:  */
 458: contract StakingRewards is Ownable, ReentrancyGuard, Pausable {
 459:     using SafeERC20 for IERC20;
 460: 
 461:     IERC20 public stakingToken;
 462:     IERC20 public rewardsToken;
 463: 
 464:     uint256 public rewardRate = 100; // Rewards per second per token (scaled)
 465:     uint256 public lastUpdateTime;
 466:     uint256 public rewardPerTokenStored;
 467: 
 468:     uint256 private _totalSupply;
 469:     mapping(address => uint256) private _balances;
 470:     mapping(address => uint256) private _userRewardPerTokenPaid;
 471:     mapping(address => uint256) private _rewards;
 472: 
 473:     event Staked(address indexed user, uint256 amount);
 474:     event Withdrawn(address indexed user, uint256 amount);
 475:     event RewardPaid(address indexed user, uint256 reward);
 476:     event RewardRateUpdated(uint256 newRate);
 477: 
 478:     constructor(address _stakingToken, address _rewardsToken) {
 479:         stakingToken = IERC20(_stakingToken);
 480:         rewardsToken = IERC20(_rewardsToken);
 481:     }
 482: 
 483:     function stake(uint256 amount)
 484:         external
 485:         nonReentrant
 486:         whenNotPaused
 487:         updateReward(msg.sender)
 488:     {
 489:         require(amount > 0, "Cannot stake 0");
 490: 
 491:         _totalSupply += amount;
 492:         _balances[msg.sender] += amount;
 493:         stakingToken.safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), amount);
 494: 
 495:         emit Staked(msg.sender, amount);
 496:     }
 497: 
 498:     function withdraw(uint256 amount)
 499:         public
 500:         nonReentrant
 501:         whenNotPaused
 502:         updateReward(msg.sender)
 503:     {
 504:         require(amount > 0, "Cannot withdraw 0");
 505:         require(_balances[msg.sender] >= amount, "Insufficient balance");
 506: 
 507:         _totalSupply -= amount;
 508:         _balances[msg.sender] -= amount;
 509:         stakingToken.safeTransfer(msg.sender, amount);
 510: 
 511:         emit Withdrawn(msg.sender, amount);
 512:     }
 513: 
 514:     function getReward()
 515:         public
 516:         nonReentrant
 517:         whenNotPaused
 518:         updateReward(msg.sender)
 519:     {
 520:         uint256 reward = _rewards[msg.sender];
 521:         if (reward > 0) {
 522:             _rewards[msg.sender] = 0;
 523:             rewardsToken.safeTransfer(msg.sender, reward);
 524:             emit RewardPaid(msg.sender, reward);
 525:         }
 526:     }
 527: 
 528:     function exit() external {
 529:         withdraw(_balances[msg.sender]);
 530:         getReward();
 531:     }
 532: 
 533:     modifier updateReward(address account) {
 534:         rewardPerTokenStored = rewardPerToken();
 535:         lastUpdateTime = block.timestamp;
 536:         if (account != address(0)) {
 537:             _rewards[account] = earned(account);
 538:             _userRewardPerTokenPaid[account] = rewardPerTokenStored;
 539:         }
 540:         _;
 541:     }
 542: 
 543:     function rewardPerToken() public view returns (uint256) {
 544:         if (_totalSupply == 0) {
 545:             return rewardPerTokenStored;
 546:         }
 547:         return rewardPerTokenStored +
 548:             ((block.timestamp - lastUpdateTime) * rewardRate * 1e18) / _totalSupply;
 549:     }
 550: 
 551:     function earned(address account) public view returns (uint256) {
 552:         return (_balances[account] *
 553:             (rewardPerToken() - _userRewardPerTokenPaid[account])) / 1e18 +
 554:             _rewards[account];
 555:     }
 556: 
 557:     function setRewardRate(uint256 _rewardRate) external onlyOwner {
 558:         rewardRate = _rewardRate;
 559:         emit RewardRateUpdated(_rewardRate);
 560:     }
 561: 
 562:     function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256) {
 563:         return _totalSupply;
 564:     }
 565: 
 566:     function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256) {
 567:         return _balances[account];
 568:     }
 569: }'''
 570: 
 571:         else:
 572:             return '''// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 573: pragma solidity ^0.8.19;
 574: 
 575: contract SimpleStorage {
 576:     uint256 private _value;
 577:     address private _owner;
 578: 
 579:     event ValueChanged(uint256 newValue);
 580:     event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed previousOwner, address indexed newOwner);
 581: 
 582:     constructor() {
 583:         _owner = msg.sender;
 584:     }
 585: 
 586:     modifier onlyOwner() {
 587:         require(msg.sender == _owner, "Caller is not the owner");
 588:         _;
 589:     }
 590: 
 591:     function set(uint256 newValue) public onlyOwner {
 592:         _value = newValue;
 593:         emit ValueChanged(newValue);
 594:     }
 595: 
 596:     function get() public view returns (uint256) {
 597:         return _value;
 598:     }
 599: 
 600:     function transferOwnership(address newOwner) public onlyOwner {
 601:         require(newOwner != address(0), "New owner cannot be zero address");
 602:         emit OwnershipTransferred(_owner, newOwner);
 603:         _owner = newOwner;
 604:     }
 605: 
 606:     function owner() public view returns (address) {
 607:         return _owner;
 608:     }
 609: }'''
 610: 
 611:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 612:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© de l'agent smart contract"""
 613:         base_health = await super().health_check()
 614:         return {
 615:             **base_health,
 616:             "blockchains": self.blockchains,
 617:             "standards": self.standards,
 618:             "security_level": self.security_level,
 619:             "tools": self.tools,
 620:             "contracts_deployed": self.config.get("contracts_deployed", 24),
 621:             "audits_completed": self.config.get("audits_completed", 15),
 622:             "gas_saved_total": f"{self.config.get('gas_saved', 1250):,} ETH"
 623:         }

  66:   - "Optimiser l'utilisation du storage"
  67: '@
  68: 
  69: $solidityAgentConfig | Out-File -FilePath "$projectPath\agents\smart_contract\sous_agents\solidity_config.yaml" -Force -Encoding UTF8
  70: 
  71: # Code du sous-agent Solidity
  72: $solidityAgentCode = @'
  73: # agents/smart_contract/sous_agents/solidity_expert.py
  74: import asyncio
  75: from typing import Dict, Any, List
  76: from pathlib import Path
  77: import json
  78: from ...shared.base_agent import BaseAgent
  79: 
  80: class SolidityExpertSubAgent(BaseAgent):
  81:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en dÃ©veloppement Solidity"""
  82: 
  83:     def __init__(self, config_path: str):
  84:         super().__init__(config_path)
  85:         self.solidity_versions = self.config.get("capabilities", {}).get("solidity_versions", [])
  86:         self.patterns = self.config.get("capabilities", {}).get("patterns", [])
  87:         self.recommended_version = "0.8.19"
  88: 
  89:     async def initialize(self) -> bool:
  90:         """Initialise le sous-agent"""
  91:         self.logger.info(f"Initialisation du Solidity Expert")
  92:         self.logger.info(f"Version recommandÃ©e: {self.recommended_version}")
  93:         return True
  94: 
  95:     async def develop_smart_contract(self, requirements: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  96:         """DÃ©veloppe un smart contract Solidity"""
  97:         self.logger.info(f"DÃ©veloppement du contrat: {requirements.get('name', 'Unnamed Contract')}")
  98: 
  99:         # Analyse des besoins
 100:         contract_analysis = await self._analyze_requirements(requirements)
 101: 
 102:         # SÃ©lection du pattern
 103:         pattern = await self._select_pattern(requirements)
 104: 
 105:         # GÃ©nÃ©ration du contrat
 106:         contract_code = await self._generate_contract_code(requirements, pattern)
 107: 
 108:         # Optimisation du gas
 109:         optimized_code = await self._optimize_gas(contract_code)
 110: 
 111:         # GÃ©nÃ©ration des tests
 112:         tests = await self._generate_tests(optimized_code, requirements)
 113: 
 114:         # Documentation
 115:         documentation = await self._generate_documentation(optimized_code, requirements)
 116: 
 117:         return {
 118:             "contract_analysis": contract_analysis,
 119:             "selected_pattern": pattern,
 120:             "contract_code": optimized_code,
 121:             "tests": tests,
 122:             "documentation": documentation,
 123:             "gas_estimation": await self._estimate_gas_costs(optimized_code)
 124:         }
 125: 
 126:     async def _analyze_requirements(self, requirements: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 127:         """Analyse les besoins du contrat"""
 128:         analysis = {
 129:             "contract_type": requirements.get("type", "custom"),
 130:             "security_requirements": requirements.get("security", {}),
 131:             "upgradeability_needed": requirements.get("upgradeable", False),
 132:             "access_control_needed": requirements.get("access_control", False),
 133:             "composability_needed": requirements.get("composable", False),
 134:             "token_standard": requirements.get("token_standard")
 135:         }
 136:         return analysis
 137: 
 138:     async def _select_pattern(self, requirements: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
 139:         """SÃ©lectionne le pattern de contrat appropriÃ©"""
 140:         if requirements.get("upgradeable"):
 141:             if "proxy" in requirements.get("upgrade_type", "").lower():
 142:                 return "Proxy Pattern (Transparent)"
 143:             else:
 144:                 return "Proxy Pattern (UUPS)"
 145: 
 146:         if requirements.get("factory_deployment"):
 147:             return "Factory Pattern"
 148: 
 149:         if requirements.get("modular"):
 150:             return "Diamond Pattern (EIP-2535)"
 151: 
 152:         return "Standard Contract"
 153: 
 154:     async def _generate_contract_code(self, requirements: Dict[str, Any], pattern: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 155:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re le code du contrat"""
 156:         # Version Solidity
 157:         version = self.recommended_version
 158: 
 159:         # Imports
 160:         imports = await self._generate_imports(requirements)
 161: 
 162:         # Contrat principal
 163:         contract_body = await self._generate_contract_body(requirements, pattern)
 164: 
 165:         # Interfaces
 166:         interfaces = await self._generate_interfaces(requirements)
 167: 
 168:         # Libraries
 169:         libraries = await self._generate_libraries(requirements)
 170: 
 171:         return {
 172:             "version": version,
 173:             "imports": imports,
 174:             "contract": contract_body,
 175:             "interfaces": interfaces,
 176:             "libraries": libraries
 177:         }
 178: 
 179:     async def _optimize_gas(self, contract_code: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 180:         """Optimise le contrat pour rÃ©duire le gas"""
 181:         optimizations = []
 182: 
 183:         # Optimisation des variables de storage
 184:         if "storage_variables" in contract_code:
 185:             optimized_storage = await self._optimize_storage_layout(contract_code["storage_variables"])
 186:             optimizations.append({
 187:                 "type": "storage_optimization",
 188:                 "description": "RÃ©organisation des variables de storage",
 189:                 "gas_saving": "~5000 gas"
 190:             })
 191:             contract_code["storage_variables"] = optimized_storage
 192: 
 193:         # Optimisation des fonctions
 194:         if "functions" in contract_code:
 195:             optimized_functions = await self._optimize_functions(contract_code["functions"])
 196:             optimizations.append({
 197:                 "type": "function_optimization",
 198:                 "description": "Optimisation des fonctions pour rÃ©duire le gas",
 199:                 "gas_saving": "~200-1000 gas par appel"
 200:             })
 201:             contract_code["functions"] = optimized_functions
 202: 
 203:         # Utilisation de assembly pour les opÃ©rations critiques
 204:         if contract_code.get("needs_assembly_optimization", False):
 205:             contract_code = await self._apply_assembly_optimizations(contract_code)
 206:             optimizations.append({
 207:                 "type": "assembly_optimization",
 208:                 "description": "Utilisation d'assembly pour les opÃ©rations critiques",
 209:                 "gas_saving": "~30-50% sur les opÃ©rations mathÃ©matiques"
 210:             })
 211: 
 212:         contract_code["optimizations_applied"] = optimizations
 213:         return contract_code
 214: 
 215:     async def execute(self, task: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 216:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che de dÃ©veloppement Solidity"""
 217:         task_type = task.get("type", "develop_contract")
 218: 
 219:         if task_type == "develop_contract":
 220:             return await self.develop_smart_contract(task.get("requirements", {}))
 221:         elif task_type == "optimize_gas":
 222:             return await self.optimize_existing_contract(task.get("contract_code", {}))
 223:         elif task_type == "add_feature":
 224:             return await self.add_feature_to_contract(task.get("feature", {}), task.get("contract_code", {}))
 225:         elif task_type == "audit_contract":
 226:             return await self.audit_contract(task.get("contract_code", {}))
 227:         else:
 228:             return {"error": f"Type de tÃ¢che non supportÃ©: {task_type}"}
 229: 
 230:     async def optimize_existing_contract(self, contract_code: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 231:         """Optimise un contrat existant"""
 232:         # Analyse du contrat
 233:         analysis = await self._analyze_contract_code(contract_code)
 234: 
 235:         # Identification des optimisations possibles
 236:         optimizations = await self._identify_optimizations(analysis)
 237: 
 238:         # Application des optimisations
 239:         optimized_code = await self._apply_optimizations(contract_code, optimizations)
 240: 
 241:         # Calcul des Ã©conomies estimÃ©es
 242:         gas_savings = await self._calculate_gas_savings(contract_code, optimized_code)
 243: 
 244:         return {
 245:             "original_analysis": analysis,
 246:             "optimizations_applied": optimizations,
 247:             "optimized_code": optimized_code,
 248:             "gas_savings_estimate": gas_savings,
 249:             "recommendations": await self._generate_recommendations(analysis)
 250:         }
 251: 
 252:     async def audit_contract(self, contract_code: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 253:         """Audite un contrat pour trouver des vulnÃ©rabilitÃ©s"""
 254:         vulnerabilities = []
 255: 
 256:         # VÃ©rification des vulnÃ©rabilitÃ©s courantes
 257:         common_checks = [
 258:             self._check_reentrancy,
 259:             self._check_overflow_underflow,
 260:             self._check_access_control,
 261:             self._check_gas_limits,
 262:             self._check_timestamp_dependency,
 263:             self._check_randomness,
 264:             self._check_front_running
 265:         ]
 266: 
 267:         for check in common_checks:
 268:             try:
 269:                 result = await check(contract_code)
 270:                 if result["found"]:
 271:                     vulnerabilities.append(result)
 272:             except Exception as e:
 273:                 self.logger.error(f"Erreur lors de la vÃ©rification: {e}")
 274: 
 275:         # GÃ©nÃ©ration du rapport
 276:         severity_levels = {
 277:             "critical": sum(1 for v in vulnerabilities if v["severity"] == "critical"),
 278:             "high": sum(1 for v in vulnerabilities if v["severity"] == "high"),
 279:             "medium": sum(1 for v in vulnerabilities if v["severity"] == "medium"),
 280:             "low": sum(1 for v in vulnerabilities if v["severity"] == "low")
 281:         }
 282: 
 283:         return {
 284:             "vulnerabilities_found": vulnerabilities,
 285:             "severity_summary": severity_levels,
 286:             "total_vulnerabilities": len(vulnerabilities),
 287:             "recommended_fixes": await self._generate_fixes(vulnerabilities),
 288:             "security_score": await self._calculate_security_score(severity_levels)
 289:         }
 290: '@
 291: 
 292: $solidityAgentCode | Out-File -FilePath "$projectPath\agents\smart_contract\sous_agents\solidity_expert.py" -Force -Encoding UTF8

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\smart_contract\sous_agents\__init__.py
   1: # Import des sous-agents

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\smart_contract\sous_agents\formal_verification\agent.py
   1: """
   2: Sous-agent Formal Verification
   3: SpÃ©cialisation: Formal Verification
   4: """
   5: from typing import Dict, Any
   6: import yaml
   7: import logging
   8: 
   9: class FormalVerificationSubAgent:
  10:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en Formal Verification"""
  11: 
  12:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = ""):
  13:         self.config_path = config_path
  14:         self.config = self._load_config()
  15:         self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  16:         self.agent_id = f"formal_verification_sub_01"
  17: 
  18:         self.logger.info(f"Sous-agent {self.agent_id} initialisÃ©")
  19: 
  20:     def _load_config(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  21:         """Charge la configuration"""
  22:         if self.config_path and os.path.exists(self.config_path):
  23:             try:
  24:                 with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
  25:                     return yaml.safe_load(f)
  26:             except Exception as e:
  27:                 self.logger.error(f"Erreur de chargement config: {e}")
  28: 
  29:         # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  30:         return {
  31:             "agent": {
  32:                 "name": "Formal Verification",
  33:                 "specialization": "Formal Verification",
  34:                 "version": "1.0.0"
  35:             },
  36:             "capabilities": ["task_execution", "specialized_operation"]
  37:         }
  38: 
  39:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  40:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che spÃ©cialisÃ©e"""
  41:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "unknown")
  42: 
  43:         self.logger.info(f"ExÃ©cution de la tÃ¢che {task_type}")
  44: 
  45:         # ImplÃ©mentation spÃ©cifique au sous-agent
  46:         result = await self._execute_specialized(task_data, context)
  47: 
  48:         return {
  49:             "success": True,
  50:             "sub_agent": "formal_verification",
  51:             "task": task_type,
  52:             "result": result,
  53:             "specialization": "Formal Verification"
  54:         }
  55: 
  56:     async def _execute_specialized(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  57:         """MÃ©thode spÃ©cialisÃ©e Ã  implÃ©menter"""
  58:         # Ã€ implÃ©menter selon la spÃ©cialisation
  59:         return {
  60:             "message": "TÃ¢che exÃ©cutÃ©e par le sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ©",
  61:             "specialization": "Formal Verification",
  62:             "input": task_data
  63:         }
  64: 
  65:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  66:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© du sous-agent"""
  67:         return {
  68:             "agent": "formal_verification",
  69:             "status": "healthy",
  70:             "type": "sub_agent",
  71:             "specialization": "Formal Verification",
  72:             "config_loaded": bool(self.config)
  73:         }
  74: 
  75:     def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  76:         """Retourne les informations du sous-agent"""
  77:         return {
  78:             "id": self.agent_id,
  79:             "name": "Formal Verification",
  80:             "type": "sub_agent",
  81:             "parent": "smart_contract",
  82:             "specialization": "Formal Verification",
  83:             "version": "1.0.0"
  84:         }

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\storage\file_based_storage.py
   1: # storage/file_based_storage.py
   2: import json
   3: import yaml
   4: import pickle
   5: from pathlib import Path
   6: from typing import Any, Dict, List
   7: from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
   8: 
   9: @dataclass
  10: class AgentState:
  11:     """Ã‰tat d'un agent stockÃ© dans des fichiers"""
  12:     agent_id: str
  13:     current_task: Dict[str, Any]
  14:     context: Dict[str, Any]
  15:     memory: List[Dict[str, Any]]
  16:     performance: Dict[str, float]
  17: 
  18:     def save(self, base_path: Path):
  19:         """Sauvegarde l'Ã©tat dans des fichiers"""
  20:         agent_dir = base_path / self.agent_id
  21:         agent_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  22: 
  23:         # Sauvegarde en JSON (lisible)
  24:         with open(agent_dir / "state.json", "w") as f:
  25:             json.dump(asdict(self), f, indent=2)
  26: 
  27:         # Sauvegarde en pickle pour la performance
  28:         with open(agent_dir / "state.pkl", "wb") as f:
  29:             pickle.dump(self, f)
  30: 
  31:         # Sauvegarde du contexte sÃ©parÃ©ment
  32:         context_file = agent_dir / "context" / f"context_{datetime.now().timestamp()}.json"
  33:         context_file.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  34:         with open(context_file, "w") as f:
  35:             json.dump(self.context, f, indent=2)
  36: 
  37:     @classmethod
  38:     def load(cls, agent_id: str, base_path: Path):
  39:         """Charge l'Ã©tat depuis les fichiers"""
  40:         agent_dir = base_path / agent_id
  41: 
  42:         try:
  43:             # Essaye d'abord le pickle (plus rapide)
  44:             with open(agent_dir / "state.pkl", "rb") as f:
  45:                 return pickle.load(f)
  46:         except:
  47:             # Fallback sur JSON
  48:             with open(agent_dir / "state.json", "r") as f:
  49:                 data = json.load(f)
  50:                 return cls(**data)
  51: 
  52: class ProjectFileSystem:
  53:     """Gestionnaire du systÃ¨me de fichiers du projet"""
  54: 
  55:     def __init__(self, project_root: Path):
  56:         self.root = project_root
  57: 
  58:         # Structure de base
  59:         self.directories = {
  60:             "agents": self.root / "agents",
  61:             "context": self.root / "context",
  62:             "memory": self.root / "memory",
  63:             "workspace": self.root / "workspace",
  64:             "sprints": self.root / "sprints",
  65:             "reports": self.root / "reports",
  66:             "logs": self.root / "logs",
  67:         }
  68: 
  69:         # Initialisation
  70:         self._init_structure()
  71: 
  72:     def _init_structure(self):
  73:         """CrÃ©e la structure de dossiers"""
  74:         for dir_path in self.directories.values():
  75:             dir_path.mkdir(exist_ok=True, parents=True)
  76: 
  77:             # Sous-structure spÃ©cifique
  78:             if dir_path.name == "agents":
  79:                 for agent_type in ["coder", "tester", "architect", "documenter"]:
  80:                     (dir_path / agent_type).mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  81: 
  82:             if dir_path.name == "memory":
  83:                 for sub in ["vector_store", "history", "learnings"]:
  84:                     (dir_path / sub).mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  85: 
  86:     def get_agent_state_path(self, agent_id: str) -> Path:
  87:         """Retourne le chemin de l'Ã©tat d'un agent"""
  88:         return self.directories["agents"] / agent_id
  89: 
  90:     def save_task_result(self, task_id: str, result: Dict[str, Any]):
  91:         """Sauvegarde le rÃ©sultat d'une tÃ¢che"""
  92:         task_file = self.directories["sprints"] / "current" / f"task_{task_id}.json"
  93:         task_file.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
  94: 
  95:         with open(task_file, "w") as f:
  96:             json.dump({
  97:                 "task_id": task_id,
  98:                 "result": result,
  99:                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
 100:                 "agent": result.get("agent", "unknown")
 101:             }, f, indent=2)
 102: 
 103:     def load_agent_context(self, agent_id: str, limit: int = 10) -> List[Dict]:
 104:         """Charge le contexte rÃ©cent d'un agent"""
 105:         context_dir = self.get_agent_state_path(agent_id) / "context"
 106: 
 107:         if not context_dir.exists():
 108:             return []
 109: 
 110:         # RÃ©cupÃ¨re les fichiers de contexte les plus rÃ©cents
 111:         context_files = sorted(context_dir.glob("*.json"),
 112:                              key=lambda x: x.stat().st_mtime,
 113:                              reverse=True)[:limit]
 114: 
 115:         contexts = []
 116:         for file in context_files:
 117:             with open(file, "r") as f:
 118:                 contexts.append(json.load(f))
 119: 
 120:         return contexts
 121: 
 122: # Utilisation
 123: project_fs = ProjectFileSystem(Path("./project_data"))
 124: 
 125: # Sauvegarde d'Ã©tat
 126: agent_state = AgentState(
 127:     agent_id="coder_001",
 128:     current_task={"id": "TASK-123", "description": "Implement login"},
 129:     context={"files": ["auth.py"], "dependencies": ["flask"]},
 130:     memory=[{"task": "previous", "result": "success"}],
 131:     performance={"accuracy": 0.95, "speed": 120}
 132: )
 133: 
 134: agent_state.save(project_fs.get_agent_state_path("coder_001"))

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\tester\agent.py
   1: """
   2: Agent Tester - Tests et assurance qualitÃ©
   3: Version complÃ¨te et corrigÃ©e
   4: """
   5: from .base_agent import BaseAgent
   6: from typing import Dict, Any, List
   7: from datetime import datetime, timedelta
   8: import random
   9: 
  10: class TesterAgent(BaseAgent):
  11:     """Agent principal pour les tests et la qualitÃ©"""
  12: 
  13:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = None):
  14:         super().__init__(config_path, "TesterAgent")
  15:         self.test_types = self.config.get("test_types", ["unit", "integration", "e2e", "security", "performance", "load"])
  16:         self.coverage_target = self.config.get("coverage_target", 85)
  17:         self.tools = self.config.get("tools", ["pytest", "jest", "cypress", "selenium", "playwright", "k6", "locust"])
  18:         self.quality_gates = self.config.get("quality_gates", {
  19:             "unit_test_coverage": 80,
  20:             "integration_test_count": 50,
  21:             "security_score": 70,
  22:             "performance_threshold": "2s",
  23:             "accessibility": "WCAG AA"
  24:         })
  25: 
  26:         # Ajout des capacitÃ©s
  27:         self.add_capability("test_automation")
  28:         self.add_capability("security_audit")
  29:         self.add_capability("performance_testing")
  30:         self.add_capability("ci_cd_integration")
  31:         self.add_capability("quality_metrics")
  32: 
  33:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  34:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che de test"""
  35:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "run_tests")
  36:         self.logger.info(f"TesterAgent exÃ©cute: {task_type}")
  37: 
  38:         if task_type == "run_test_suite":
  39:             test_type = task_data.get("test_type", "unit")
  40:             result = {
  41:                 "test_report": self._generate_test_report(test_type),
  42:                 "quality_gates": self._check_quality_gates(),
  43:                 "recommendations": self._generate_test_recommendations()
  44:             }
  45:         elif task_type == "security_audit":
  46:             target = task_data.get("target", "smart_contract")
  47:             result = {
  48:                 "security_report": self._generate_security_report(target),
  49:                 "risk_assessment": self._assess_security_risk(),
  50:                 "remediation_plan": self._create_remediation_plan()
  51:             }
  52:         elif task_type == "performance_test":
  53:             scenario = task_data.get("scenario", "normal_load")
  54:             result = {
  55:                 "performance_report": self._generate_performance_report(scenario),
  56:                 "bottleneck_analysis": self._analyze_bottlenecks(),
  57:                 "optimization_recommendations": self._suggest_performance_optimizations()
  58:             }
  59:         elif task_type == "load_test":
  60:             user_count = task_data.get("user_count", 1000)
  61:             duration = task_data.get("duration", 300)
  62:             result = {
  63:                 "load_report": self._generate_load_report(user_count, duration),
  64:                 "scalability_assessment": self._assess_scalability(),
  65:                 "infrastructure_recommendations": self._suggest_infrastructure_improvements()
  66:             }
  67:         elif task_type == "fuzzing_test":
  68:             target_component = task_data.get("target_component", "api")
  69:             result = {
  70:                 "fuzzing_results": self._generate_fuzzing_results(target_component),
  71:                 "vulnerabilities_found": self._identify_fuzzing_vulnerabilities(),
  72:                 "robustness_score": self._calculate_robustness_score()
  73:             }
  74:         elif task_type == "accessibility_test":
  75:             result = {
  76:                 "accessibility_report": self._generate_accessibility_report(),
  77:                 "wcag_compliance": self._check_wcag_compliance(),
  78:                 "improvement_plan": self._create_accessibility_plan()
  79:             }
  80:         elif task_type == "api_test":
  81:             endpoints = task_data.get("endpoints", [])
  82:             result = {
  83:                 "api_test_report": self._test_api_endpoints(endpoints),
  84:                 "api_quality_score": self._calculate_api_quality_score(),
  85:                 "api_best_practices": self._check_api_best_practices()
  86:             }
  87:         else:
  88:             result = {
  89:                 "testing_completed": True,
  90:                 "quality_metrics": self._calculate_quality_metrics(),
  91:                 "defect_analysis": self._analyze_defects(),
  92:                 "test_maturity": self._assess_test_maturity()
  93:             }
  94: 
  95:         return {
  96:             "status": "success",
  97:             "agent": self.name,
  98:             "task": task_type,
  99:             "result": result,
 100:             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
 101:             "test_duration": f"{random.randint(30, 600)} secondes"
 102:         }
 103: 
 104:     def _generate_test_report(self, test_type: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 105:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re un rapport de test"""
 106:         reports = {
 107:             "unit": {
 108:                 "total_tests": random.randint(100, 500),
 109:                 "passed": random.randint(95, 495),
 110:                 "failed": random.randint(0, 10),
 111:                 "skipped": random.randint(0, 5),
 112:                 "coverage": f"{random.randint(70, 95)}%",
 113:                 "duration": f"{random.randint(30, 300)}s",
 114:                 "suites": ["models", "services", "utils", "components"],
 115:                 "fastest_suite": "utils",
 116:                 "slowest_suite": "integration",
 117:                 "flaky_tests": random.randint(0, 3)
 118:             },
 119:             "integration": {
 120:                 "total_tests": random.randint(50, 200),
 121:                 "passed": random.randint(48, 195),
 122:                 "failed": random.randint(0, 5),
 123:                 "skipped": random.randint(0, 2),
 124:                 "coverage": f"{random.randint(60, 85)}%",
 125:                 "duration": f"{random.randint(60, 600)}s",
 126:                 "components_tested": ["API", "Database", "Cache", "External Services"],
 127:                 "test_environments": ["staging", "test"],
 128:                 "data_setup": "Fixtures + Factories"
 129:             },
 130:             "e2e": {
 131:                 "total_tests": random.randint(20, 100),
 132:                 "passed": random.randint(18, 95),
 133:                 "failed": random.randint(0, 5),
 134:                 "skipped": random.randint(0, 2),
 135:                 "coverage": f"{random.randint(50, 80)}%",
 136:                 "duration": f"{random.randint(120, 1200)}s",
 137:                 "browsers": ["Chrome", "Firefox", "Safari"][:random.randint(1, 3)],
 138:                 "user_flows": ["Login", "Checkout", "Dashboard", "Settings"],
 139:                 "screenshots_on_failure": True,
 140:                 "video_recording": True
 141:             }
 142:         }
 143: 
 144:         return reports.get(test_type, reports["unit"])
 145: 
 146:     def _check_quality_gates(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 147:         """VÃ©rifie les portes de qualitÃ©"""
 148:         return {
 149:             "unit_test_coverage": {
 150:                 "target": f"{self.quality_gates.get('unit_test_coverage', 80)}%",
 151:                 "actual": f"{random.randint(70, 95)}%",
 152:                 "passed": random.choice([True, False]),
 153:                 "threshold": "minimum 80%"
 154:             },
 155:             "integration_test_count": {
 156:                 "target": self.quality_gates.get('integration_test_count', 50),
 157:                 "actual": random.randint(40, 100),
 158:                 "passed": random.choice([True, False]),
 159:                 "threshold": "minimum 50 tests"
 160:             },
 161:             "security_score": {
 162:                 "target": f"{self.quality_gates.get('security_score', 70)}/100",
 163:                 "actual": f"{random.randint(60, 90)}/100",
 164:                 "passed": random.choice([True, False]),
 165:                 "threshold": "minimum 70/100"
 166:             },
 167:             "performance_threshold": {
 168:                 "target": self.quality_gates.get('performance_threshold', '2s'),
 169:                 "actual": f"{random.uniform(0.5, 3.0):.2f}s",
 170:                 "passed": random.choice([True, False]),
 171:                 "threshold": "maximum 2 secondes"
 172:             },
 173:             "accessibility": {
 174:                 "target": self.quality_gates.get('accessibility', 'WCAG AA'),
 175:                 "actual": random.choice(['WCAG AAA', 'WCAG AA', 'WCAG A', 'Non conforme']),
 176:                 "passed": random.choice([True, False]),
 177:                 "threshold": "WCAG AA minimum"
 178:             }
 179:         }

 198:     def _generate_security_report(self, target: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 199:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re un rapport de sÃ©curitÃ©"""
 200:         tools_used = random.sample(["Slither", "Mythril", "Echidna", "Foundry", "Manticore", "Oyente"], random.randint(2, 4))
 201: 
 202:         return {
 203:             "target": target,
 204:             "tools_used": tools_used,
 205:             "scan_duration": f"{random.randint(300, 1800)} secondes",
 206:             "vulnerabilities": {
 207:                 "critical": random.randint(0, 2),
 208:                 "high": random.randint(0, 4),
 209:                 "medium": random.randint(0, 6),
 210:                 "low": random.randint(0, 8),
 211:                 "informational": random.randint(2, 10)
 212:             },
 213:             "security_score": random.randint(50, 95),
 214:             "risk_level": random.choice(["low", "medium", "high", "critical"]),
 215:             "top_vulnerabilities": self._generate_top_vulnerabilities(target),
 216:             "compliance": {
 217:                 "owasp_top_10": random.choice(["Compliant", "Partially compliant", "Non-compliant"]),
 218:                 "smart_contract_best_practices": random.choice(["Followed", "Partially followed", "Not followed"]),
 219:                 "cwe_covered": random.randint(20, 80)
 220:             }
 221:         }

 223:     def _generate_top_vulnerabilities(self, target: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 224:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re les principales vulnÃ©rabilitÃ©s"""
 225:         if target == "smart_contract":
 226:             vulnerabilities = [
 227:                 {
 228:                     "name": "Reentrancy",
 229:                     "severity": "critical",
 230:                     "description": "Attaquant peut appeler rÃ©cursivement la fonction avant la fin de l'exÃ©cution",
 231:                     "location": "withdraw() function",
 232:                     "fix": "Utiliser le pattern checks-effects-interactions ou implÃ©menter un reentrancy guard"
 233:                 },
 234:                 {
 235:                     "name": "Integer Overflow/Underflow",
 236:                     "severity": "high",
 237:                     "description": "Les calculs arithmÃ©tiques peuvent dÃ©passer les limites du type",
 238:                     "location": "balance calculations",
 239:                     "fix": "Utiliser SafeMath ou vÃ©rifier les limites avant les calculs"
 240:                 },
 241:                 {
 242:                     "name": "Access Control",
 243:                     "severity": "medium",
 244:                     "description": "Fonctions sensibles accessibles sans autorisation appropriÃ©e",
 245:                     "location": "admin functions",
 246:                     "fix": "Ajouter des modifiers onlyOwner ou onlyRole"
 247:                 }
 248:             ]
 249:         else:
 250:             vulnerabilities = [
 251:                 {
 252:                     "name": "SQL Injection",
 253:                     "severity": "critical",
 254:                     "description": "EntrÃ©es utilisateur non validÃ©es dans les requÃªtes SQL",
 255:                     "location": "User search endpoint",
 256:                     "fix": "Utiliser des prepared statements ou un ORM"
 257:                 },
 258:                 {
 259:                     "name": "XSS (Cross-Site Scripting)",
 260:                     "severity": "high",
 261:                     "description": "JavaScript malveillant injectÃ© via entrÃ©es utilisateur",

 263:                     "fix": "Encoder les sorties HTML et valider les entrÃ©es"
 264:                 },
 265:                 {
 266:                     "name": "Insecure Direct Object References",
 267:                     "severity": "medium",
 268:                     "description": "AccÃ¨s direct aux objets sans vÃ©rification d'autorisation",
 269:                     "location": "File download endpoint",
 270:                     "fix": "ImplÃ©menter des contrÃ´les d'accÃ¨s au niveau des objets"
 271:                 }
 272:             ]
 273: 
 274:         return random.sample(vulnerabilities, random.randint(1, 3))

 277:         """Ã‰value le risque de sÃ©curitÃ©"""
 278:         return {
 279:             "overall_risk": random.choice(["low", "medium", "high"]),

 283:             "threat_model": {
 284:                 "privilege_escalation": random.choice(["possible", "unlikely", "mitigated"]),
 285:                 "data_exfiltration": random.choice(["possible", "unlikely", "mitigated"]),
 286:                 "denial_of_service": random.choice(["possible", "unlikely", "mitigated"]),
 287:                 "financial_loss": random.choice(["possible", "unlikely", "mitigated"])
 288:             },
 289:             "recommended_actions": [
 290:                 "Mettre en place un WAF",

 293:                 "Former l'Ã©quipe aux bonnes pratiques de sÃ©curitÃ©"
 294:             ]

 320:     def _generate_performance_report(self, scenario: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 321:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re un rapport de performance"""
 322:         scenarios = {
 323:             "normal_load": {"users": 100, "duration": 300},
 324:             "peak_load": {"users": 1000, "duration": 600},
 325:             "stress_test": {"users": 5000, "duration": 900},
 326:             "spike_test": {"users": 10000, "duration": 60}
 327:         }
 328: 
 329:         config = scenarios.get(scenario, scenarios["normal_load"])
 330: 
 331:         return {
 332:             "scenario": scenario,
 333:             "configuration": config,
 334:             "metrics": {
 335:                 "requests_per_second": random.randint(50, 500),
 336:                 "response_time_p50": f"{random.randint(100, 500)}ms",
 337:                 "response_time_p95": f"{random.randint(500, 2000)}ms",
 338:                 "response_time_p99": f"{random.randint(1000, 5000)}ms",
 339:                 "error_rate": f"{random.uniform(0, 5):.2f}%",
 340:                 "throughput": f"{random.randint(100, 1000)} req/s",
 341:                 "concurrent_users": config["users"]
 342:             },
 343:             "percentiles": {
 344:                 "10th": f"{random.randint(50, 200)}ms",
 345:                 "50th": f"{random.randint(100, 500)}ms",
 346:                 "90th": f"{random.randint(500, 2000)}ms",
 347:                 "95th": f"{random.randint(1000, 3000)}ms",
 348:                 "99th": f"{random.randint(2000, 5000)}ms"
 349:             },
 350:             "sla_compliance": {
 351:                 "availability": f"{random.uniform(99.0, 99.99):.2f}%",
 352:                 "response_time": random.choice(["Within SLA", "Borderline", "Violation"]),
 353:                 "throughput": random.choice(["Meets requirements", "Below requirements"])
 354:             }
 355:         }

 358:         """Analyse les goulots d'Ã©tranglement"""

 391:

 463:         """SuggÃ¨re des amÃ©liorations d'infrastructure"""
 464:         improvements = [

 495:         ]

 498: 
 499:     def _generate_fuzzing_results(self, target_component: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 500:         """GÃ©nÃ¨re des rÃ©sultats de fuzzing"""
 501:         return {
 502:             "target": target_component,
 503:             "iterations": random.randint(1000, 100000),
 504:             "crashes": random.randint(0, 10),
 505:             "timeouts": random.randint(0, 5),
 506:             "coverage_increase": f"{random.randint(5, 30)}%",
 507:             "unique_paths": random.randint(50, 500),
 508:             "bugs_found": random.randint(0, 15),
 509:             "fuzzing_strategy": random.choice(["Coverage-guided", "Generation-based", "Evolutionary"]),
 510:             "tools_used": ["AFL", "libFuzzer", "Jazzer", "Honggfuzz"][:random.randint(1, 3)],
 511:             "effectiveness": random.choice(["High", "Medium", "Low"])
 512:         }
 513: 
 514:     def _identify_fuzzing_vulnerabilities(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 515:         """Identifie les vulnÃ©rabilitÃ©s trouvÃ©es par fuzzing"""
 516:         vulnerabilities = [
 517:             {
 518:                 "type": "Buffer Overflow",
 519:                 "severity": "critical",
 520:                 "location": "Input parsing function",
 521:                 "trigger": "Overly long string input"
 522:             },
 523:             {
 524:                 "type": "Integer Overflow",
 525:                 "severity": "high",
 526:                 "location": "Array index calculation",
 527:                 "trigger": "Large integer value"
 528:             },
 529:             {
 530:                 "type": "Memory Leak",
 531:                 "severity": "medium",
 532:                 "location": "Resource allocation function",
 533:                 "trigger": "Repeated allocation without free"
 534:             },
 535:             {
 536:                 "type": "Race Condition",
 537:                 "severity": "high",
 538:                 "location": "Concurrent access function",
 539:                 "trigger": "Simultaneous access from multiple threads"
 540:             }
 541:         ]
 542: 
 543:         return random.sample(vulnerabilities, random.randint(0, 3))
 544:

 547:         return {

 658:         }

FICHIER : D:\Web3Projects\SmartContractDevPipeline\agents\tester\sous_agents\e2e_tester\agent.py
   1: """
   2: Sous-agent E2E Testing
   3: SpÃ©cialisation: E2E Testing
   4: """
   5: from typing import Dict, Any
   6: import yaml
   7: import logging
   8: 
   9: class E2ETesterSubAgent:
  10:     """Sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ© en E2E Testing"""
  11: 
  12:     def __init__(self, config_path: str = ""):
  13:         self.config_path = config_path
  14:         self.config = self._load_config()
  15:         self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
  16:         self.agent_id = f"e2e_tester_sub_01"
  17: 
  18:         self.logger.info(f"Sous-agent {self.agent_id} initialisÃ©")
  19: 
  20:     def _load_config(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  21:         """Charge la configuration"""
  22:         if self.config_path and os.path.exists(self.config_path):
  23:             try:
  24:                 with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
  25:                     return yaml.safe_load(f)
  26:             except Exception as e:
  27:                 self.logger.error(f"Erreur de chargement config: {e}")
  28: 
  29:         # Configuration par dÃ©faut
  30:         return {
  31:             "agent": {
  32:                 "name": "E2E Testing",
  33:                 "specialization": "E2E Testing",
  34:                 "version": "1.0.0"
  35:             },
  36:             "capabilities": ["task_execution", "specialized_operation"]
  37:         }
  38: 
  39:     async def execute(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  40:         """ExÃ©cute une tÃ¢che spÃ©cialisÃ©e"""
  41:         task_type = task_data.get("task_type", "unknown")
  42: 
  43:         self.logger.info(f"ExÃ©cution de la tÃ¢che {task_type}")
  44: 
  45:         # ImplÃ©mentation spÃ©cifique au sous-agent
  46:         result = await self._execute_specialized(task_data, context)
  47: 
  48:         return {
  49:             "success": True,
  50:             "sub_agent": "e2e_tester",
  51:             "task": task_type,
  52:             "result": result,
  53:             "specialization": "E2E Testing"
  54:         }
  55: 
  56:     async def _execute_specialized(self, task_data: Dict[str, Any], context: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  57:         """MÃ©thode spÃ©cialisÃ©e Ã  implÃ©menter"""
  58:         # Ã€ implÃ©menter selon la spÃ©cialisation
  59:         return {
  60:             "message": "TÃ¢che exÃ©cutÃ©e par le sous-agent spÃ©cialisÃ©",
  61:             "specialization": "E2E Testing",
  62:             "input": task_data
  63:         }
  64: 
  65:     async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  66:         """VÃ©rifie la santÃ© du sous-agent"""
  67:         return {
  68:             "agent": "e2e_tester",
  69:             "status": "healthy",
  70:             "type": "sub_agent",
  71:             "specialization": "E2E Testing",
  72:             "config_loaded": bool(self.config)
  73:         }
  74: 
  75:     def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
  76:         """Retourne les informations du sous-agent"""
  77:         return {
  78:             "id": self.agent_id,
  79:             "name": "E2E Testing",
  80:             "type": "sub_agent",
  81:             "parent": "tester",
  82:             "specialization": "E2E Testing",
  83:             "version": "1.0.0"
  84:         }

  16:         self.agent_id = f"fuzzing_expert_sub_01"
  17: 
  18:         self.logger.info(f"Sous-agent {self.agent_id} initialisÃ©")
  19:

  21:         """Charge la configuration"""

  23:             try:
